description:
This is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant on Nob Hill with amazing service and fabulous food. We went to celebrate my husbands birthday and enjoyed a special of fresh tomato soup, Cesar salad and caprese salad to start. My entree was the spicy pork sausage fettuccine which was amazing. I felt like I was in South Philly which is a compliment coming from me. My husband had the rack of lamb with farro and it was done perfect-the temperature - medium rare. It's obvious their produce and meats are high quality. Oh don't let me forget the focaccia served first. 
Christian was our server and surprised my husband with a birthday Tiramisu. Thank you Christian! 
We are not drinkers but it looked like a great wine list and cocktails too. There is a little bar too! I wish I took pictures!
author: Ann P.

description:
Service was not very good. We checked in and were told would only be 20 minutes. It took at least 15 minutes to order a drink at the bar while we were waiting. 2 parties came after us and for some reason were sat before us. 

It seems the staff sits the neighborhood snob hill residents before anyone else is able to be seated. 

Poor experience do not recommend.
author: Matt T.

description:
OMG the best Italian food short ribs to die for, pizza and sea food no wonder you need a  reservation
Im coming back tomorrow !!!!
Our concierge at the Ritz Carlton  recommended this place and got us in.  This is must to come to !!!!
I even ordered another pizza to go....
author: Adrian C.

description: I passed by this restaurant so many times, and finally got to try the place. The servers are very friendly, and the ambience of the restaurant is very romantic. This is a good date spot, or a great place to catch up with a girlfriend. The gnocchi was very very good. Perfect texture and perfect flavors. Fettuccini Carbonara was not too bad. It went very well with the sangrovase. This is a very cute Italian restuarant in Nob Hill and you should try it at least once. I would come back here again.
author: Lisa O.

description: Just an okay dining experience but nothing to write home about and therefore given the high price I'm rating it lower than I otherwise would. They served us a basket of bread while waiting for our food and it was very mediocre bread. I would expect a denser, less white dough type bread at a fancy Italian restaurant and I would expect it to be warm. The waitstaff was very professional but the seating host was sloppy and unprofessional. He didn't match the $$$ price. I wish this was a more down to earth neighborhood place for the sake of the locals like me, but sadly I won't be going here again given the mismatched mediocre food with the $$$ price.
author: Sarah C.

description: We had a quick meal here.  The host allowed us to eat early and squeezed us in.  We had the wood fired pizza, and a caesar salad.  The waiter was kind enough to allow us to split plates.  I found the food here to be really authentic.  It's a great room and I found service to be good.  They have really good wines by the glass.
author: Jeff C.

description:
A nice, romantic spot for a delightful Italian meal, all paired with some quality wine. Whether it was a hearty dish of meatballs with mozzarella and marinara sauce to start, yet another hearty dish of pork milanese with polenta as the main course, and a not-too-sweet, not-too-bland piece of pie to finish, everything was quite satisfying going down. The servers were also on point with some red wine recommendations to go along with everything. 

It's a small, intimate venue, so be sure to make reservations if you plan on coming here at peak times.
author: Vincent L.

description:
The food is delicious with a feel of your Italian Grandmother's spirit watching over you as you smile in delight. I can't say is as memorable but definitely hearty and aromatic, and date I say tasty. Ultimately, the ambiance is the star of this show.

A dimly lit room on the corner of what feels like the top of SF, stares gently at the Bay Bridge which glimmers in the background on a clear night. Chatter amongst other guests lingers in the air but never intrudes. Tightly nestled tables with white parchment on top takes down the pretentious nature of most restaurants of this caliber.

The service would be my only "compliant". Perhaps it was a busy night, but regardless, we felt slightly judged and perturbed as if we were annoying with our desire to purchase copious amounts of wine. Are we to be blamed? Drink up!
author: Kevin J.

description: Loved this little gem. Tiny restaurant with personal service and fabulous food. Pasta was rich and wonderful, salads fresh. My sister loved the lamb. Would eagerly return here next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Wendy B.

description:
You know, I really wanted to love this place, but it just fell short of expectations all around. Nothing bad, just not what you'd hope from from a place of this caliber. More than anything, it was very expensive for what we got, in my opinion.

We previously made a reservation for 8 and wanted to update it to include 2 more. They had to push the reservation time back 30 minutes (understandable for dinner-time), but when we arrived, they still had us seated at three separate tables! So, we didn't get to interact with our entire group. Terrible start.

The service was actually really good and the food was fine, as well. Dessert was the best part. If you end up here, definitely save room for the Tiramisu.

It's completely possible that our seating arrangement affected my overall experience and, if it weren't for that, this may have very well been a 4-5 star review.
author: Kirk M.

description: Incredibly average Italian dining experience considering the big price tag. The food was mediocre and expensive. Service was alright. Wouldn't recommend.
author: Giuseppe E.

description: I came as a single diner with no reservation and was instantly made to feel welcome.  My drinks,(rye old fashioned), and my meal were fantastic.  Service was awesome!  All in all a great experience.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Ron T.

description: Some of the best gnocci and eggplant parmesan I've ever had. Great (and pricey) wine selection. Perfect for a romantic date in Nob Hill. Only loses a star because both times I've been there I had servers who said they didn't work there and were "filling in". They didn't know the menu and were not very attentive.
author: acolight s.

description: Delicious pizza. Shoutout to Santos. He literally goes above and beyond every time to make our experience amazing.
author: Jasmine G.

description: I dare you to not be completely enchanted by this sweet little resataurant stop a hill in San Francisco. The view of the Bay Bridge is breathtaking. We were there last weekend on rare winter a date night.  The menu is not huge so curated to what they make best I'm assuming...We listened to our fellow Yelpers and ordered the eggplant app. Too die for, melt in your mouth, tastes like old Italy deliciousness. For dinner I got spaghetti carbonara, so rich and my only complaint is that it was so delicious I ate too much of it and was left feeling full! The hubs ordered duck bolognese and it was also very rich. Only complaint is that it was a bit salty for my taste. We started with a cocktail and then a recommended glass of vino with dinner and we were pleased with our choices. The place is fairly small so make a reservation. We did and were seated within 5 minutes of arrival. At first glance we were concerned that the tables seemed awfully close together but it somehow still feels intimate and dare this old married lady sat, romantic?! Our server was lovely, helpful and attentive.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Excellent service and even greater food. Every dish was prepared with the perfect balance of subtlety, flavor, and quality ingredients.
author: John G.

description:
Found a roach in my water.....hmmmm protein water....it was disgusting 
They said it's because the ice machine broke and they're getting it from another place
author: Kevin B.

description: We ended up at this place because the original restaurant had a long wait- so we walked and came here to have dinner and it was so good! The portions were just right. They have a limited pasta choice but our friends and I had 3 of the 4 pastas on the menu (we didn't have the one with scampi) and all were good! The pizza was really good too! Their sausage was what made the dishes good!
author: Sapana P.

description: Another great night at Venticello!   This place is truly a gem.   We were served by Tim who was super nice and helpful.   He only works on Sundays so we will certainly make a point to go back on Sunday nights!   Thanks again for a fantastic evening.
author: Seth T.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with a special friend without a reservation =0 and they were exquisite about it.

Te restaurant is on the corner of Taylor and Washington in Nob Hill, nicely tucked away in the neighborhood, so if you're visiting, you'll have to take a taxi there as parking is awful, and you'll experience us - local San Franciscans.  

The ambiance is intimate, and on two levels. The maitr accomodated us at a cozy table on the top floor by the entrance near the stairs going down to the lower dining hall. When he realized my friend was chilly, he closed the entrance door for her. Nice touch of attention.

The service was casually friendly, and subtle.  The food is solid authentic Italian. We shared the Tiger Prawns - grilled and wrapped in bacon... Yum!

I had the Carbonara and it was as good as you can find it in my native city of Milan.

Good job. For authentic Italian in Nob Hill, go here.
author: Massimo M.

description: Great charmer restaurant in San Francisco.  Great setting in Nob Hill, and yummy Italian food.  It's a great place for a date night.  Definitely best to get a seat near the lower area windows or near the bar.  Not inexpensive, yet a good special occasion spot.
author: David O.

description: Visiting from St Charles, MO. Excellent personal service and opportunity to talk about our trip with Daniel and staff. Dinner pasta, wine and dessert were just what I've been looking for in this big city. Safe quiet neighborhood for walking or parking at nighttime during our visit. The trolley goes right down the street looking out the dining room windows. I'll make it a point to revisit this restaurant on our next visit. Thank you!
author: C S.

description: Excellent food, great and friendly service (Thank You, Daniel), wonderful location. Will return.
author: Tanner P.

description: Since Nob Hill was insanely packed, we walked over to Venticello. We were greeted by Tracy. She was so friendly I had to give her a hug. Maybe it's because she is originally from HTX, and of course I must show love to transplants from TX. They do take reservations, and Tracy was so sweet she was able to hook us up with a table since we did not have a reservation. This place is tiny, so reservations are recommended. I had the gnocchi and Brussels sprouts with bacon bits. Yum! My colleague did not care for their Caesar salad, but she loved their salmon dish. My other colleague ordered a lemon drop martini, but they forgot the sugar coated rim. Our server was cute, but was not as attentive for such a tiny place. Overall, MY evening experience was good with a very delightful host.
author: Oliver B.

description: My husband and I celebrated his birthday and our wedding anniversary here. The service was good and the food excellant. It reminded me of the dining in Europe where one is not rushed to finish. It was charming.
author: Teri H.

description:
Eggplant appetizer....outstanding.  Brick oven pizza with sliced figs....madonna!!!...Sea Bass...Incredible!!!!
Enjoy people.....oh and a wonderful view of the bridge.
author: Lou V.

description: OMG - fantastic food.   Lovely, cozy atmosphere.  Ate here before a performance and enjoyed it thoroughly.  Highly recommend.
author: Monica W.

description: Fantastic food and a real cozy environment. It feels like an authentic Italian restaurant.
author: Wilson L.

description: I have never been disappointed by a dish at Venticello; some of the best Italian food in San Francisco. The restaurant has an intimate feel, perfect for a date night out.
author: Monique M.

description:
Small more intimate restaurant. Make reservations! 

I ordered the braised lamb with polenta and roasted brussel sprouts and we shared a meatball appetizers which came with 6 baked, plump, juicy, cheesy meatballs. I loved that they left the bones on the plate that when picked up had the meat slipping off. Being the classy lady I am, I successfully sucked out the bone marrow and gnawed at the cartilage without making a big scene.

While waiting for my order, I happily munched on their fluffy, warm focaccia bread and dipped it in oil and balsamic vinegar.

They're able to pull off excellent service with really only 1 or 2 servers and the hostess stepping in from time to time to help out. Great neighborhood gem and can't wait to come back!
author: Lauren K.

description: Very disappointed.  I had higher expectations for this neighborhood restaurant.  Carpaccio was good but the remainder of the meal, Caesar salad, pasta with duck was average at best.  Apple pastry dessert was bad.   All the above rounded out by a server that was seemed to rushed or distracted to offer any meaningful guidance with the menu.  So many good choices in the area.  No need to be coming back here
author: Iggy M.

description: We enjoyed meal here in early December, 2017. Made reservation and cab driver didn't even know about hidden gem. You can tell residents and travelers know about the great service and quality. It was our first time dining experience here and you can bet we'll be back. Welcoming and quality wine and veal with a nice green salad. Food was made to order and place quaint and not in a hurry to turn table. Highly recommend this establishment! Aloha and thanks for a nice evening!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Staff is courteous, food is great, ambience is perfect for a date. 

Must: spaghetti carbonara.  
Skip: Breaded pork Milanese. It's not horrible, just not as great as everything else.
author: Sara H.

description: Cute little litalian place tucked away in the streets of San Francisco! My husband and I love coming here. Food is amazing and ambiance is romantic.
author: Jessica B.

description: Love to visit this place with my friend. Excellent, small local Italian joint. Portions aren't terribly big so definitely add an app per person if you're looking to get filled! All was delicious.
author: Sara G.

description: The food here is excellent. The ambiance is so romantic and the staff is exceptional. Perfect for a date night or to come with friends and family. You can listen to the cable cars go by over a delicious meal. I also love to sit at the bar when I'm dining solo. Fantastic cocktails and a great wine menu!
author: gianna g.

description: Came here the other night with friends. I'd been here several times before and had excellent service and food. Tonight our waiter was rushed and literally tossed our plates of food on the table and gruffly asked if two of us wanted any cheese with our pasta dishes and proceeded to completely cover the dish with the grated cheese. I think he was having a bad night. Everything else was perfect, the food, drinks, staff. We had a table up near the bar which was perfect for our little group to catch up. I will definitely be back, hopefully our waiter was having an off night.
author: Marguerite E.

description:
I really wanted to like this place because of the location and great ratings I read online, but with all the amazing Italian restaurants in San Francisco, this one merely earns  3.5 stars at best.

The ambiance itself is nice and cozy - there's a bar upstairs and the downstairs walks into the dining room. However, I don't know if it's the layout or how the tables are set up but I kept feeling claustrophobic. The wait staff told me to move my purse to the other side of the chair to free up space for them. Still, I had several people bump into me when they had to go to the restroom or servers dropping utensils a number of times nearby. Overall, this didn't sit well with me when I was trying to enjoy the beautiful wine we started with.

We brought two wine bottles with us and unfortunately the first one had a delicate cork that broke- they did end up bringing a strainer to get rid of it which helped us out a lot and we still enjoyed it! Our second bottle was sadly corked. In lieu of the second bottle, we purchased a bottle from their wine list. 

In regards to the food - it was overall pretty underwhelming. We ordered the Carpaccio ($16), Seafood Risotto ($29), and Cioppino ($29). The Carpaccio was fresh but very bland. I wasn't offered fresh black pepper and there was no olive oil nor much of any AIoli spread on it. Call me picky, but shouldn't Carpaccio be complete when served?

The seafood risotto was probably the best- which was chosen by my bf. It was great but I still prefer Milano's in Russian Hill (more shrimp/prawns) but the consistency of the risottos  were both good.

The Cioppino's broth was actually solid - however, the seafood was not. The prawns (only 2 pieces) and clams were tasty, but the mussels tasted super fishy and old.

Overall, everything here was just extremely mediocre- except for the wonderful company, wine, and Risotto. From beginning, the service was already lackluster and the food just didn't blow me away. I will likely skip recommending Venticello to my friends in the future with all the wonderful Italian restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Veronica S.

description:
Irresistibly San Francisco. 

The cozy old SF home setting, quaint tables and the clang clang of the cable car bell as it passes by ...

Yes, my friend. Life is good.

Bite into your perfectly grilled tiger prawns dipped in chili sauce and relish the crusty bread to whet your appetite. You'll be tempted to order the pizza or go for a healthy salad, but wise locals know to go straight for the pasta (the al dente fettuccine with spicy fennel pork sausage is scrumptious!) or one of the tantalizing entrees like the veal scallopini. Pounded thin, served with braised wild mushrooms and kale over creamy polenta, it's a classic Northern Italian dish done right. Finish off on a (sugar) high note with the intensely dark chocolate budino. Buon gusto!

If you're celebrating as we were, a bottle of Drussian extra dry prosecco comes in at $44 which hardly breaks the bank, but draws happy giggles from two ladies on a night out.

Now I know Venticello in Italian simply means: Nob Hill's best kept secret.
author: Janice C.

description:
Made a reservation on OpenTable and was skeptical due to ease of getting an open reservation but with positive yelp reviews thought it's worth a shot and I was so happy. I dined here with coworkers and to start ordered the meatballs, eggplant, and shrimp along with tasty bread. Meatballs were really tasty and came with 6 medium-sized meatballs and plenty of sauce for dipping. Shrimp was also really tasty and accompanied by the spicy sauce. The bread is so delicious and really soft and chewy. Coworkers all ordered caesar salads and I ordered the kale salad. Kale salad was really tasty with apple and nuts. Nice size portion and tangy delicious dressing. For my meal, I had the pappardelle with lamb and cherry peppers. All their pasta is homemade so I really think it's the way to go! Even though I was stuffed I finished almost all of it. Also one of my biggest issues is food served warm and the pasta was piping hot so made it that much more enjoyable. My two other coworkers ordered the veal chop with brussels sprouts and they seemed to really enjoy as well. 

All in all, service was great and with the ability to make a reservation relatively easily, I recommend this place.
author: Aryn C.

description:
5 stars!    When a place goes above and beyond with exceptional service, delicious food and a great all around vibe, I come to Yelp to shower them with praise and coax others to check it out, and Venticello is a perfect example of this.

Friday night, Valentine's Day weekend and I am without a reservation!  You guys know what is a risky game to be playing in the city.  So, in a rush, I go to OT and see a place right up the street from Miss's house, that I have bookmarked on Yelp has a 8pn slot, so what do I do?  I close the computer before completing the reservation (forehead slap, facepalm combo!!!).

So I stroll up with MISS on my arm and learn that this bustling place doesn't have us down and panic inside while looking at the delicious food all around us and feeling the glare of a getting hangry MISS.  But to my delight, the Manager said, "no worries, I understand and we will be able to seat you in just a sec, how about a couple Proseccos while you wait, compliments of the house?"  Ummm, YEAH!  So as we waited outside and took in the lovely views of the lit up Bay Bridge, we sipped our pretty tasty Champagne and life was, once again grand.

Once seated, Casey, our Server, was quick to get us started by opening the wine we'd brought and telling us about the specials, but we'd already made up our minds and went with the Steak Tartare to start, which was classic Italian style with Arugula and Capers and quite good to start.

Next, we had an order to share of the Pappardelle, house-made Pasta that they split for us, without us having to ask, though I always want more pasta than HER (bring me all the noodles!!!).  It was delicious and I licked the bowl clean (not really).

Miss had the Hangar Steak which she said was great and I had the Lamb Shank with Polenta which was BOMB!  I ate so much that I was barely able to make a decent stab at the Tiramisu we ordered for dessert.

In a town chalk full of good Italian food, Venticello is great.  Go see for yourself!

Pro tip:  They have a few very good Ports, so save room for Porto!

LS
author: Lee S.

description: Snobbish service. We were looked down upon because we did not order wine. Service was slow as we waited 20 mins to order without bread or water. The view is really good and the atmosphere is great. The sausage on the pizza was amazing but the pizza itself was a little plain. Decent prices for the cool atmosphere but the snobbery knocked a star off for me.
author: Jamal J.

description: Love this place! Great location in Nob Hill that feels like old school San Francisco. Very inviting and warm when you walk in. The wine selection is fantastic and the food is delicious. The service has been excellent every time I have been. Great views of the bay bridge and downtown when you step out the door. Definitely worth the trip up the hill of your staying in the Union square area. After you eat walk around and check out Grace cathedral and Huntington park for a slice of beautiful San Francisco.
author: J W.

description:
Wanted to go somewhere near the Masonic and this was really good and convenient! 

We had the meatballs to start - good flavor but odd texture. We still liked them. Then we had the salmon special. Grilled. With mashed potatoes and cherry tomatoes. What a delicious combination!! Loved it. Would definitely come back. Really nice atmosphere and good service.
author: Karen N.

description: Wonderful experience with the Hunny for our anniversary. Pleasant and delightful staff. Food was great. Perfect date!
author: Jen G.

description:
Solid 4 restaurant: I walked past this restaurant and from the street, thought it looked like a very cute neighborhood restaurant. I came here with a 7:30pm reservation on a Monday night. We were seated at a two top with a great view of the street corner and beautiful restaurant ambiance. The restaurant wasn't too busy, which added to the calm, pleasant feel. Service was attentive and friendly. We ordered the meatballs (highly recommend, smells and tastes delicious), black kale salad (average salad, but you'll probably need greens somehow), sea bass (thumbs up) and chicken wrapped in prosciutto (too salty for me, but my date enjoyed it).

Overall, I think this restaurant makes a fabulous dinner selection if you're looking for nice ambiance and decent food. It's not AMAZING food, but you won't be disappointed. The space works very well for two people and small groups, and even private parties. It feels like the inside decor is meticulously picked out and arranged for the pleasant ambiance.
author: Melissa T.

description: We live in the neighborhood and have been here several times.  Unfortunately, our last visit did not go well at all.  We arrived on time for our reservation and were told that Open Table had double booked reservations and we would either have to wait 45 minutes or sit at the bar (which is very small and cramped and was not actually available at the time).  The host was not the least bit apologetic.  I've booked hundreds of reservations on Open Table and not once have been told there was a double booking.  Very disappointed.  We left and do not plan to return.
author: Julieana A.

description:
What's so great about Venticello? Why, I'm glad you asked!

- Homemade pasta. Get the fetuccini or the carbornara.
- Homemade bread. Did you even know they handed out bread at restaurants in California anymore?
- You can order from their great wine list or, better yet, bring in your own bottle
- Romantic, softly-lit atmosphere
- Friendly staff
- I've referred 3 different people here and they've all raved about their experience
author: Audrey A.

description:
What a gem of a place 
Everything was so delicious 
The place is really beautiful
You can make reservations!
Had the spaghetti and meatballs for my son
Delicious 
Myself the Papperdella pasta with duck out of this world 
Hubby had pasata with spicy sausage 
everyone pleased
author: Linda R.

description: This place is just yum. The staff is kind and courteous, the food is great, and it's just the right amount of classy yet not stuffy. Beautiful location in Nob Hill too. My friend and I had the gnocchi, and we couldn't get enough of it! Their wine list is also great, the Pinot I had was delicious.
author: Micaela B.

description: As good as we remembered it from 15 years ago.  The baked eggplant is friggin amazing. I had the sausage pizza -crust thin and light just like the best pizzas in Rome, and wife had pasta carbonara which she loved. We'll be back!!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Came here on Christmas Eve with my boyfriend as my gift this year. Food was beyond expectations, however the service was a little lacking. Our waitress was great, but it was obvious they were understaffed. Showed up for our reservation on time and still had to wait 30 minutes for our table plus an extra 10-15 for our waitress to get to us, causing us to miss the church service we were planning to attend.

That being said, our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairings, and our food was so delicious. The cioppino is so rich, I couldn't believe there wasn't heavy cream in it! 

Great food, just think we may have hit them on a bad night. Unfortunately, after our experience there, it just isn't worth the money to try again.
author: Ella P.

description:
Excellent Italian restaurant with fair prices and amazing food. The interior is adorable and romantic, and my waiter was wonderful. Found Venticello via Yelp and made a reservation for my bf's birthday on a Saturday. We arrived around 6:30pm and the restaurant was half full. By the time we left around 8:00pm, the restaurant was packed. Venticello definitely looks a lot nicer in the evening!

We ordered the pappardelle with wild boar and lamb shank as our entrees. Both were lovely! The pappardelle pasta tasted extremely fresh and savoury, just the right portions too. The lamb shank was great as well, but the meat was just a little too tough for my taste. I've definitely had much tender lamb shank elsewhere, so I might recommend trying a different meat entree. The lamb shank came with polenta (yum) and brussel sprouts. After our meal, our waiter surprised my boyfriend with tiramisu (totally recommend ordering this as a dessert) and a candle on top for his birthday which I thought was a really nice gesture! 

I love the authentic feel of Venticello and how the waiters are really detail-oriented to make sure that you're enjoying every aspect of your meal.
author: Claudia C.

description:
Delicious meal and great service! 

Food:
-Pappardelle with wild boar: Fresh-tasting flat-noodle pasta with a light, flavorful sauce. The wild boar tasted like a tender, stewed beef. I was concerned it might be gamey, but it wasn't at all. 

-Sea bass: Moist, flaky fish wrapped in crispy pancetta. The polenta was prepared differently than I've seen before. It was like a barley. I ordered the tapenade on the side because I don't like olives, but my tablemate tried it and enjoyed it. I thought the flavors were great without it. 

-House bread: this was like a focaccia, very light, subtly salty on top.

Ambiance: this restaurant is very tiny. It is also WARM. It was completely full on a Sunday night. I'd definitely make reservations if you're set on eating here. We were lucky and went here on a whim and got the last available table. If you sit on the lower level within view of the window, you can see the Bay Bridge--so pretty! 

Service: No complaints here. The waiter was very friendly and prompt. The assistants brought bread quickly and kept our drinks full.
author: Susan G.

description: I have lived in the neighborhood for 20 years and have been going to this restaurant forever. Unfortunately, there is a lot of server turnover and the latest chef got rid of their signature appetizer dish the grilled tiger prawns. They changed the delicious spicy sauce they had for years and years and replaced it with a bland unappealing roasted tomato aioli. They need to keep the original recipe available. All my neighbors complain about the same thing. Bring the sauce back! Last, this is an Italian restaurant. I asked for the classic angel hair pasta sauce. The waiter looked confused and said he will see if the chef knows how to prepare that, even after I gave him the 4 ingredients to make it. Really?
author: Jill P.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant I "finally" got around to going to. Driving by, it can easily be missed as it blends in with the block. Simple yet warm decor.

Our waiter "Seamus" was incredible.  Everything you want.  Friendly, attentive and funny :)

The food was great.  We started with the Pear/Gorgonzola Pizza.  Now if you're like me I'm going wtf... fruit pizza?  But hey it worked!!!  Very tasty and delicious.  Thank god the ladies said they could only eat one slice because of the carbs.  MORE FOR ME!   Another app we had was the roasted eggplant.  OMG.... the sauce that it came in alone was amazing! I used the bread to soak up every drop of it ;).  Upon Seaumus's suggestion I had the fettuccine.  Rule of thumb.  Always listen to the staff!  It was soooooo goooood :).  Dessert.  Who could only pick one?  Piggies that we were, we had the chocolate cake w/sea salt that came with coffee ice cream DAMN GOOD.  Mascarpone w/fruit, very refreshing.  And the tiramisu (oh cummon can't eat italian without it) delicious.

We will definitely be back!  Laffing.  One of our guests liked it so much she is coming back with a friend next week :)
author: Rigs R.

description: My wife and I were looking forward to celebrating our two year anniversary at Venticello.  It can recommend to us by a few friends.  We arrived on time and were seated right away. We started with the meatballs and they were great! Salads were next and they were both just ok. My wife and I both ordered pasta dishes for our mains. When the pastas arrived both of them looked and smelled incredible.  As we started to dig-in we were put back by the amount of Salt in both meals.  After a few more bites, both pastas were inedible!  Not cool!  Water please! We let our server know and had the dishes taken away. The manager offered to re-fire other dishes but we declined.  They comped one of the mains and we left. It might have been a fluke but we probably won't coming back.
author: Stacey K.

description:
As Italian I always try to research authentic Italian restaurants where to bring friends and family.

I visited yesterday for the first time Venticello and I will never I mean NEVER need to go back!

We tried something simple like a pasta and pizza. While the pasta was ok, the pizza was hand down the worst pizza I had in the states, if you remove the frozen one server at some work events, since I came to the United States in 2007. I really do not understand all these great reviews. Service was so so ambience is fine, location is great. This is definitely a missed opportunity from the owner to convert a restaurant placed in a lovely location into something special.
author: Claudio C.

description: This is a great place to eat. I love the "small corner restaurant" feel if it. Me and my family ordered the carpaccio, Cesar salad, sausage pizza, fettuccine, and today's special the snapper. The carpaccio was great. The pizza had a floppy crust but had some good flavors. The snapper was amazing, it paired well with the risotto. I liked the service and the waiter was very kind. It took a little time for the food, the bread was a little cold, and it took some time to get a seat. Overall the menu had much variety for the family, the service was good, and the food was delicious. Hope that review helped and you try this excellent restaurant.
author: Trent M.

description: Nice and up and coming...maybe? clientale is definitely older and not really trendy, but the food is perfectly  excecuted and the environment is cozy, a lil loud when packed though and bonus points for the brick pizza oven. I personally had the pork chop with roasted apples which had a nice smoky sweet flavoring and paired well together. The standard is to cook the chop medium so request well done if that ain't  your thing. My friend had a the chicken and asparagus, the chicken had a to die for sear, literally perfectly browned and even on the outside and super moist inside with a light rosemary flavoring. The waitstaff is friendly and pretty attentive even when it's crowded, they did forget our brussel sprouts as an appetizer, but it's wasn't a big deal seeing as the dinner plate portions or ample. FYI- if you're driving here parking will be hard to find, take a lyft.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
This place is great. A gem!

Very friendly and welcoming staff. View and setting is very romantic. Food was delicious.
We would definitely return and recommend to friends.
author: Ronnie J.

description: We come here once month. Service we got was okay although we witnessed other service around us being much better, especially the waitor servicing the older couple next to us. Homemade focaccia bread was excellent and the wood fired pizza I had for my entree was very good. My wife had the gnocchis which melt in your mouth. Wine selection is okay, but could be better.
author: Brian G.

description: I haven't been here in 15 years so I decided to take colleagues from out of town to see a nice neighborhoody restaurant. Last time I came was with my wife (then girlfriend) and we thought things were mediocre but blamed it on valentines day crowds. Well, sorry to say, the place is still mediocre food, ok service (although they didn't rush us which I liked) and way overpriced. The locals know the truth - go to nob hill cafe down the street, its local and much more quality. Only issue is no reservations, which is how I opened this cam of worms in the first place! (Btw, you somehow know it ain't great when the busser is hanging out texting by the bathrooms indefinitely)
author: Andrew S.

description: This restaurant was simply amazing. We went to eat here after our wedding. They honored our reservation promptly, they greeted us with glasses of presecco, and they were all very congratulatory. But let talk food- I'm not a steak eater but I tried my husbands skirt steak and oh my gosh it was amazing! The eggplant was fantastic, and the sea bass was on point, there was. I thing there I didn't love. Sweet, intimate atmosphere. Go here!
author: Alley T.

description: This hidden gem near Fairmont Hotel offers some amazing dishes. On a packed saturday night the service and food works like clock work. For this eatery coming from Los Angeles it was a breathe of fresh taste.
author: Hovsep M.

description:
I found this Italian place great, and would be a great place to enjoy a slow and quiet evening. Among my friends and I, we did not get alcohol but we got an appetizer. 

FOOD: We started with an appetizer, which was meatballs. Mighty delicious as the meatballs were not dry or drowned in sauce. That's always my complain about most meatballs. I got the seared ahi tuna (the special), and found it to be heavenly. My friends also got the lamb shank, which I tried and found to be heavenly. 

SERVICE: Nothing out of this world, but very good for the price of about three dollar signs. 

I will say the wine list prices are pretty steep, so that's why we opted out. But overall, mighty good Italian food and great ambiance.
author: Albert H.

description:
Venticello is great. If you are looking for a solid Italian spot with a romantic atmosphere, it's a great spot.

The space is tight and not the most comfortable chairs, but it's worth it for the enchanting arrival at the corner of Taylor overlooking the bay and the sparkling bay bridge below. If you care about that sort of thing.

Food was delicious. We got the meatballs and eggplant to start which while very similar dishes were both worth getting. Definitely not the best meatballs I've ever gotten (they were a little overcooked), but hearty and warm for a cold night in San Francisco. Eggplant was covered in a delicious tomato sauce and melted cheese - yum.

We then shared the sausage pizza and the fettucine with tomato cream sauce. Both were perfect and just what we wanted. 

Not the most amazing Italian food you'll ever have in your life (or maybe it will be depending on your experience), but very solid and worth trying for a romantic Nob Hill date.
author: Rachel L.

description: The gnocchi was good, very rich but good. The fish was fishy.  The waitress was just plain old rude.
author: Kathy P.

description: Still one of my fav neighborhood restaurant despite surprisingly disappointing service from the hostess tonight. Have been here for quite a few times and the food has never disappointed. This time, we made a reservation well in advance only to be given a tiny table (that's fitted for 2) for a party of three after a long wait for the hostess. The waiter's service was slightly better. The food itself is fantastic, particularly the veal chop and the beef carpaccio.
author: Vivien S.

description:
This review is a WIP and I wanted to unpost it 
Veal was watery
Meatballs tough
Veg under veal and polenta good
Martini and Manhattan good
service great
Bread was focaccia like which was good but not my style. 
Not very vegetarian friendly
author: Alan B.

description: Went for 9:30 seating for New Years. Got seated at 10:10. Dodd was great that was attill available; they ran out of deserts, steak, appetites. Service was poor and extremely overworked. No apologies for wait. Two servers and very understaffed. At midnight all the employees left restaurant to watch fireworks. No champagne glasses on New Years?
author: James W.

description:
My husband and I were visiting San Francisco from Seattle for the first time over the weekend. After doing some research on Yelp and seeing that Venticello's was close to our hotel and had good reviews, we made reservations.
We arrived about 5 minutes before our reservation and were met by 3 different people, the 2 servers and the hostess. After a few minutes our hostess asked us to follow her and then tried to seat us at a table with another couple. The other couple and us gave the hostess a strange look and she realized what just happened and lead us back to the front door to have us wait a bit longer. The hostess then apologized and broke a wine glass right in her hand (which never got cleaned up fully). I felt terrible because then she just started crying, the next thing we knew she grabbed her purse and left - it was unclear if she got the rest of the night off or lost her job.
We waited a bit longer until we were seated at a small two-top, with a foot between our neighbors, it felt like we were having dinner with strangers. The wine list is great, but the dinner options are limited, I wish there was more choices. We settled on the margarita pizza and the cioppino. Our food came quickly. We both instantly noticed the absence of garlic in both our dishes, strange. Maybe garlic was 86'ed on the night? Also, there were 3 dead mussels, and one dead calm that was served in the dish - this means the shells never opened when cooked. Typically these dead mussels/clams are removed before serving and are a sign of the shellfish lack of freshness. It didn't taste that fresh. Furthermore the bread served with the cioppino was placed in the stew and was a soggy mess on the bottom of the dish, kind of gross. Also the bread was burnt, and the kitchen continued to burn the bread, because the restaurant stunk. When we pointed out the dead shellfish to our server, we were offered dessert, but didn't get a choice of what we wanted. The tiramisu was good but nothing out of this world.
It was really disappointing! The restaurant was cute but the food was not good, the whole experience was strange. If you like good seafood, this is not the place for you.
author: Bri S.

description: Unfortunately, this spot was a huge letdown. Mediocre borderline bad. I don't mean to sound like a snob but you just know when you're having quality Italian and this was very underwhelming. Make the trip over to little Italy and hit up Tomasos or Italian homemade company!
author: Dawn S.

description:
Having lived in the neighborhood for 5 years, it was about time I tried this place!  We came for a Saturday night dinner and not realizing it was the eve of Valentine's, found rose petals tastefully splashed on each table.  The meal:

Sea bass:  Because I'm a pescetarian, I asked for this without pancetta, which they were happily able to do.  Since the farro it comes with also has pancetta, the kitchen substituted a nice creamy but firm polenta.  Overall, it was very tasty.

Chicken saltimbocca:  my boyfriend said this was delicious but a little salty (consistent with other yelp reviewers)

Wine:  the $25 corkage fee, though steep, is worth it for 2 people since the glasses of red start at ~$12 each.  

Bread:  The warm bread they bring you prior to the meal is addicting.
author: Sona P.

description:
I have had the pleasure of being hosted by the team twice in the past two months, under very different circumstances.  Once as a regular guest with my partner for dinner, which can be described simply as an incredibly romantic and deliciously authentic Italian meal accompanied by great value Sicilian mountain red wine.

The second occasion as a guest of a charity event that was raising funds for the Nob Hill Association.  It was a beautifully executed event that had an incredible vibe and atmosphere to it.  A true testament to the nature of the entire management of Venticello.  

Thank you so much to every on the team.
author: Ian B.

description: I'm always impressed by the Italian places,and food of course, so I said to stop by and again I was surprised by the very good food and services as well. Thank you guys.
author: Donnie B.

description:
Went here for a birthday dinner.  It is a great place for dates and also to have a nice classy dinner with friends. Perched atop Nob Hill, it had a breathtaking view of the city. As soon as we walked in the host made us feel welcome and comfortable. The atmosphere inside was gorgeous and I felt as if I stepped into a Tuscan villa. The bread promptly brought to our table was extremely fresh, still warm as if straight out of the oven, and was the softest moistest bread that I had ever tasted. The homemade garlic dip was excellent.

Glad I got to try most of the food here since we all ordered different things so we could try each other's food. Notable menu items:
STARTERS:
~beef carpaccio
~Meatball
~Pancetta wrapped shrimp
MAINS:
~ Margarita Pizza
~ Spaghetti carbonara with home-made pasta and wanted to faint it was so good! The cream sauce was rich in flavor, but not too heavy or salty. 
~ Oxtail papardelle
~Cioppino
~Risotto
Not to forget dessert:
~ Strawberry cheesecake
~Panna Cotta

This experience brought Venticello to one of the top of my list of Italian restaurants
Pros: Carbonara, the bread, the cheesecake, ambiance, romantic, intimate 
Cons: A little pricey for me, but well worth it! Parking is expensive!
author: Maria M.

description: Every single thing we ate and drank was simply fabulous! Ambiance was quaint and inviting. Servers were kind and attentive. Best tiramisu we have ever had... Hands down! Thank you for making my husband's birthday such a wonderful experience! Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Dava M.

description: If you are in San Francisco and looking for great Italian Food you have got to try Venticello. We were lucky enough that it was within walking distance from the Scarlet Huntingdon and offered after 9 dining.  Seriously this is one of the hardest things to find in any city.  I had the Tuna special which was delicious and fresh. My daughter had the eggplant which also deserves some accolades.  The ambiance was very relaxing and the wait staff friendly attentive and helpful. It was a great dining experience!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
been going to this restaurant since 1998. Brought guests there for dinner on 4/29 and was so disappointed. There was a birthday party of ten sitting down stairs, which is normally a intimate space. The noise that went on for almost two hours was absolutely terrible. Could not hear anything at our table and was so obnoxious. when I called to complain was told "out of our control". Give me a break-why would you sit 10 VERY loud people in that setting. Who's restaurant is ??
Bottom line, guests were not comfortable and not going back nor recommending to any friends, only enemies. Also, the chianti that used to be $35 is now $58....rip off!
author: John S.

description: Food was great (4 star)  but the server appeared annoyed by our very existence (1 star). My three teenage sons and I had been touring San Francisco all day and chose this place because it was 3 blocks from the Fairmont where we are staying. He actually rolled his eyes when my youngest son asked if he could just have plain spaghetti with marinara. The food was delicious but I felt like we were inconvenience instead of a valued customer. He never once even asked if there was anything we needed so we promptly paid and left. $200 dollars to be treated rudely? No thanks! Save your money and eat somewhere with great service. Room service at the Fairmont has 1000 times better service. Disappointed!
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Scanning the room as I entered the softly lit room, I could feel the warm buzz of reunion melting into the easy quiet of old friendships. A smartly dressed man with a carefully concealed urgency took my name as I squinted to find my purpose here. He had not yet arrived. I decided to wait by the door, pressing myself to the mirrored wall so as to glimpse the servers as they swung through the doors from the bright kitchen, sweeping doubly across the floor as their shadows grew and shrank before them.

Soon my old friend had arrived and we were sitting so that our knees swept against the fresh linen as we crossed and uncrossed our legs with the waxing and waning conversation. Course after course poured seamlessly out of the swinging doors, all painted to match the candlelight: an auburn soup, meatballs which sunk deliciously into their red sauce, pale scallops atop a bed of golden cubes of butternut squash, a crisped slice of fish, and, finally, the darkness of chocolate cake to signal an end to the frenzy.

My body seemed to pull apart, pressed downward by the weight of food and friendship against hot organs, and yet floating with the fiz of champagne, each word bringing us closer to an end, yet delightful to observe as it bubbled up from some unseizable force of communication toward the air--interrupted only briefly by the kind busser Santos slipping in and out of view as he poured water cleanly over our ice. The rush of those waves would certainly cover us forever, and yet, as such endless evenings always must, the tide ebbed and we exited to find our way through the dark hills and shake off our champagne.
author: Virginia S.

description:
It was a fine meal- but I was not impressed overall. I went with a group of 6 and the service was fine but the food was only ok. 

We started out with a wood-fired pizza to share a an appetizer. It was ok- not anything to be excited about. Meatballs were good. 

I lucked out and ordered the spaghetti carbonara- and it was very good. Three of us at the table got this plate and we were all happy with it. If you do come here- this was the plate to order. Two of my friends ordered fish dishes, and were underwhelmed. My fiancé got the parpadelle,  thought it was ok. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. There are simply better italian restaurants out there. And the bill for 6 of us (two bottles of wine) was $360.  Not horrible, but again, you can do better for this price.
author: Lauren L.

description:
There is practically a horde of Italian restaurants in Nob Hill and Russian Hill area. I would describe Venticello as classic, but not super inventive. But they get the basics down really good.

Service was pretty awesome. Our waitress was attentive and came by frequently, but not too often that we'd get annoyed.

Food was pretty good. As I said above, not terribly inventive, but delicious nonetheless. If you're looking for a hearty Italian meal without frills, this is perfect. Soft focaccia bread with olive oil/balsamic is provided when you sit. I wish the bread was warm and crusty, but it wasn't too bad otherwise.

The eggplant rollatine appetizer was very good. Smothered in tomato sauce and packed with flavor. Yum. For entree, I got the fettucine with pork fennel sausage in a tomato cream sauce. This was really good. The pork sausage had a lot of flavor and wasn't drowned out by the tomato sauce. Portion was pretty good size. Slight spiciness in the sauce.
author: Sherry L.

description:
This is a group review. We decided on four stars instead of five because our waiter, Christian, was a little preoccupied with being cutsie than serving our needs. 
The four stars (should be five) are definitely for the food. 
Next time and there will be a next time but we will make sure we get a different waiter.
author: Paula R.

description:
I liked how this place was tucked away hidden among residents. We came here for my sister's birthday and it was really packed, but I had a res. The wait staff was very nice and the food was delicious. We started with carpaccio and margarita pizza. I can say I liked the pizza, it's rare in SF to find good pizza. The bread was thin and crispy enough and the fresh ingredients really made it.
I got the T-bone and my husband got the lamb shank. Both meats were really tender and juicy. Can't believe it was only our first time. Would definitely want to come back to try other dishes.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: This is a great little Italian place in Nob Hill. The food is always excellent, I had the wild boar paperdelle This is the more upscale sister restaurant to the Nob Hill cafe. Service for the most part was quick and efficient.
author: Thomas R.

description:
We found this little gem for a quick dinner before a show at the Masonic. It was a great find - the service was excellent and the menu and wine list were just right.
This evening we enjoyed an appetizer - carpaccio, which was tasty and reminiscent of carpaccio we had in Italy; the Caesar salad was zesty and crisp; and the pastas were obviously fresh and house made - gnocchi with a mushroom ragu was filling and a perfect balance of light pasta and succulent sauce and the parpadelli with boar ragu was the perfect comfort dish for a chilly evening in the city.
This was a truly pleasurable find - attentive service from Tim, quality, and a real value.
author: Dominic S.

description:
The place is cozy /classy neighborhood spot 
Prices are reasonable. Not recommended for small children. 
Food
The tuna carpaccio is a must
We hade four different pastas and all were good
author: Nick V.

description:
Underwhelming

Nice venue... The potential to be a good restaurant if they knew how to cook and serve food!
author: Yaz S.

description:
So was hoping for a casual evening out with my companion for the evening and was definitely feeling some Italian food. So after a little bit of searching, I find Venticello and it fits the bill perfectly. We made a reservation and head on over on a Saturday evening. 

The restaurant is in a neighborhood and it is right next to the trolley so it feels San Franciscan. (sorry for butchering that spelling). When you step into the restaurant to your left is the lower room for dining and it was nice to see the trolley going by and it's a bit livelier from what I could tell. A classy restaurant with a nice ambiance and perfect for a casual dinner date.

We sit down and peruse the vino list which was a nice selection offering a good range of vinos from a price and blend perspective. The menu is simple and neat offering good traditional Italian cuisine. We ordered the Arancini, and I ordered the Spaghetti Carbonara. The Arancini was excellent and the textures were great. The crispy risotto was a nice touch to the plate and it paired really well with the vino we had ordered. I enjoyed the pasta quite a bit and my companion ordered the pappardelle which I also thought was quite good. Solid hearty Italian food which is exactly what I was hoping for so no complaints on any end on the restaurant. The service was also very good as the manager came over and joked with us along with the waiter being quite friendly and making sure we were happy with our dishes.  The prices here are also super reasonable for San Francisco.

All in all, a great experience. Definitely a fan and I will be sure to be back to try other dishes in the future.
author: Dan M.

description:
I live about 2 blocks away (not even) and I decided that instead of eating at my place, I would go out. I don't own a car (since this is San Francisco) so I walk everywhere, 2 blocks is not far for me. As soon as I walked through the door I was greeted by who I do believe is the owner. The place is very cozy and quaint. Almost a little bit too cozy, however, I was there at a decent hour that it wasn't too busy. The reason for the three stars:
Took over 20 minutes to have a waiter come to the table...just to give me water

The appetizer was great, but the dinner was okay. I felt that I needed to add quite a lot of salt to make up for the lack of taste.

Other than those cons, I would go back again. I think I would choose other items on the menu.
author: Olive R.

description: Another nice dinner. Foxy was our server.  She did an awesome job: fun, attentive, and not rushed. I had the veal. My guest had the bass and the seafood risotto. All meals were great.
author: Bruce K.

description: The service was excellent and prompt. The food was delicious and we loved the bread they served. Very good selection of wines beyond just the wine list on top of a full bar. The atmosphere and ambiance was very relaxing. Will definitely come back again!
author: Rick S.

description: Great place for dinner before or after going to The Masonic Theater.  Quaint neighborhood spot on a corner, with Cable Cars rolling by.  Food was delicious...especially the Caesar Salad.  Cristiane was friendly and attentive despite being very busy.  We will definitely be back.
author: JT S.

description: Great neighborhood place for a nice Italian meal.  Friendly staff and an informal atmosphere.  I also ate at the bar once and enjoyed chatting with the bartender and a terrific pasta and salad.  Very convenient if you are staying on nob hill
author: Chris D.

description:
My friends took me here for a belated birthday dinner and it was my first visit. My other friends highly recommended this place so it was on my list. Get a reservation early as it was packed by the time we got our food. The manager was very attentive and was able to recommend dinner options for us. 
The dinner was fabulous and the wine by the glass selection was wonderful. 
I love smaller neighborhood places and this place fits the bill.
author: Lisa B.

description:
THANK you for helping to make my father's birthday a success. My father is probably the pickiest eater I've ever met...he only likes a handful of restaurants in the city and does not eat the following items: spicy food, saucy food, lemony food...basically he's a chicken and potatoes kind of guy. I decided to take a risk and try out a new restaurant, and he loved Venticello! 

The appetizers were the best part of the meal; I highly recommend the arancini, the carpaccio, and the melanzane. Great dishes to share. I ordered the pappardelle with wild boar sauce. It wasn't what it typically served in Italy (sorry if I sound like a snob) but the homemade pasta was super yummy and the dish had extra large pieces of wild boar which I really appreciated. The best pasta dish, however, was the fettucine with sausage..the sauce to pasta ratio was perfect.

They have a decent wine list, although the wine by the glass list was a bit small. They were also really accommodating when it came to my youngest brother's order (he's super picky as well). I will definitely eat there again.
author: Regina L.

description:
We really enjoyed the fresh pasta and neighborhood feel of this family owned restaurant.  Great selections for the wine from the full  bar and the prices were reasonable. Fresh Halibut with polenta was the fish special and it was prepared to perfection.  Foxy was our server and she was very knowledgeable about the food selections and attentive.
 Will be back to try other selections on the menu for sure.  Our server was very good and efficient. Only tow blocks down from California St. and Taylor St. (nob hill) without the Nob Hill prices !!  This will be a frequent flyer spot for me...
author: GREG C.

description: A good solid Italian restaurant that is luckily in my neighborhood.  I am glad I finally came here for dinner as I was so curious.  Grazie.
author: Maile N.

description: Some of the best fresh pasta I have ever had in my life! We got the spaghetti carbonara and the Fettucine and both were superb. Not to mention the lovely views at night of the Bay Bridge
author: Casey T.

description:
Lovely dinner with my wife and 2 friends. Made a reservation the day before for a Sunday evening slot. 

Great atmosphere for a nice meal with friends. From the right tables, you can see a glimpse of the Bay Bridge and its light show at night.  The entrance is on the top floor with the bar and a small number of tables.  This area overlooks the main dining floor below.  On first entering, I felt the blast of warm air at the top level.  Glad we were at the bottom level.

Very cordial and friendly service. Allowed corkage. 

For appetizers, we had salads. The Caesar, a Kale, and a beet salad.  All very nicely done. For main courses, we had Cioppino (Classic with thin broth, nice spice, flavorful, 2 slices of thick grilled bread to mop up the juices) and a Boar Pappardelle (very nice chunks of boar over the pasta and a thick sauce; it compared well to a similar dish I had in Italy last year.  Went very well with a glass of Barbera.).  

We felt compelled to try the Caramel gelato (creamy and a nice touch of salt), 
Vin Santo and Biscotti (classic Italian after dinner treat), and the Chocolate Torte (moist, firm, chocolatey goodness, sprinkled with powdered sugar).
author: Dave R.

description:
Been to this place a few times now... It's a great neighborhood gem.  Everything I've had here is really good.  I really like the beef carpaccio and the spaghetti carbonara.  But honestly, everything is good.  

The service is impeccable.  I always get the same girl (she has a cute lip piercing) and she's super sweet and nice.  Last night, we were the last ones in the restaurant and she didn't rush us at all.  She even brought us gelato compliments of her so that we didn't feel rushed finishing our after dinner ports.  Super sweet of her.  

The place doesn't have a full bar, but has a good selection of hard liquors.. And of course wine.  =)  Great for me since I don't drink wine and always want a nice cocktail with dinner instead of wine.
author: Vicky T.

description: This place is a charming, traditional SF neighborhood restaurant. I'm a sucker for corner cafes and this place did not disappoint. I had a really yummy pre-birthday dinner here. It's best just for a two person date - I wouldn't come here with a group larger than 4. Get the risotto.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Tucked into a corner in nob hill is this cute and romantic restaurant. I would have never thought of going here if it were not for one of my friends. 

I must first thank the owners for not being angry with us being 15 minutes late...that was very cool. We were warmly greeted and quickly seated....great views downstairs btw of the baybridge.

We were first served amazing warm, what appeared to be home baked bread, with an amazing garlic dipping sauce.

My friend had the portabello mushroom app and I the Ceasar Salad both were very good.

Our pasta courses were: the fettuccine with fennel pork sausage and tomato cream and the carbonara.....both were amazingly good..portions were very nice...not gigantic but good.

We split the third dish which was the chicken over creamy potatoes and spinach....everything was rich and flavorful.....just yummy.

For a special night I would recommend this place.
author: David G.

description: Fine service, great food. I ordered the risotto with tiger prawns and diver scallops. It was beautiful and tasty. Boyfriend ordered a special, salmon with lemon pesto sauce. He really liked it; I thought it was a bit too lemony. We shared the mushroom gnocchi, which was my favorite of the three. No wine. With tip, came out to just under $90. I'd go again!
author: Shelly T.

description:
Apologies to Fun for what I'm about to do to their song, "We are Young" in honor of the most amazing dinner at one of Nob Hill's hidden gems:

Tonight
we are starving
so let's hop a car for hire
find food on fire
that is YUM

Venticello is the place
You've got sauce on your face
You don't care,
It's just so good, maybe we could share an app to start?
The fish sounds delish
Yes I'll have dessert
I ate so much, now carry me home
 
I don't think it gets much better than Venticello.  From the quaint, friendly nature of the restaurant to the most amazing food, to the best level of service, wow am I glad we found this restaurant!

We started with the antipasto platter which was a plethora of uniquely prepared and delicious starters.  Even the lettuce was trying hard with it's perfect dressing and perky greens.  Then I had ahi encrusted with spices on top of polenta and spinach...each bite was a moment of pure bliss.  And how could I forget the bites I was able to score of goat cheese raviolis which were the softest, freshest pillows of rich goat cheese encased in handmade pasta? 

When you have such an amazing meal, you have to finish it with dessert and cappuccinos (that's a rule, I've read somewhere).  So we finished out the evening with perfectly pulled espresso and foam paired with panna cotta.  This desserty goodness that is Panna cotta will make you cry....tears of JOY.

All in all, a fantastic evening made possible by great company, delicious food, lovely ambiance, special dessert and fantastic service, Thanks Venticello!
author: Robin L.

description:
Tasty food. Good but pricey wine list. 

Nice ambiance and very friendly service.
author: Christopher M.

description:
Venticello is a quaint Italian restaurant in a primarily residential section of the Nob Hill neighborhood.

Apart from the complimentary foccacia bread served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar that would've been much better had it been warm, and the meal's end with the less than stellar bombolini dessert of orange and vanilla donuts with chocolate ganache and creme anglaise - the main course was pretty stellar.

For the main course, we opted for the special wood fired pizza with fennel, spicy sausage, and gremolata and the gnocchi al funghi. The pizza was thin, crisp, and the fennel an amazing complement to the sausage flavor. The gnocci was melt-in-your-mouth amazing - a bit on the rich side - but nonetheless amazing.

Kudos to the Venticello for removing the dessert from our final bill due to our dissatisfaction - great customer service!

Tip: Be sure to make a reservation! The place is tiny.
author: Mansi A.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. Excellent food and service. Intimate atmosphere in a charming setting. We (party of 3) had salmon, gnocchi, and lamb shank. All outstanding. Make reservations. If you want to arrive at 7:30 or so be prepared to potentially wait a ( short) while as the folks at your table will probably linger to enjoy this place a bit longer.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Review is based off of initial service, NOT food or waiter service.

I was so excited to try Venticello, and my husband and I came in this evening to hopefully eat here. When I found the host, I said, "Hi there is 2 of us for dinner." He rudely responded "I don't have any room." Okay, well we are willing to wait. After minor prodding, he said "well I have a 3 and a 4 in front if you." I replied, "that's okay, do you know how long it will be?" He said, "20 min, or you can try our sister restaurant Nob Hill Cafe." I replied "oh they have an hour wait." At that point the host turned to another server and said, "WELL, that was a SLAG OFF" and walked away and shut the door. So incredibly rude, and such a shame as I was really so excited to eat here and sample the delicious food. After that initial greeting with the host, I can certainly find nicer establishments (Ala Romana) to spend my $$ in. 

(Also, long time user of yelp, but never felt inspired to write a review until the shitty service I experienced tonight!)

Giving 1 star just bc I have to.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I chose this restaurant for an anniversary with my boyfriend. We ordered the prosciutto shrimp, prime rib, rack of lamb, and tiramisu. All in all, the food and the service we received was just.. so so. 

Three stars overall, minus one star for the server (not our server, thank goodness) who I saw wipe his nose with his fingers, grab food from the kitchen, and serve it WITHOUT WASHING HIS HANDS. This must be some kind of health violation?!
author: Nancy L.

description:
It must have been an off night.  We moved into the neighborhood last May.  I'd been looking forward to trying this place.  Finally got the opportunity last Friday.  Very disappointing.  I'd read the reviews and was looking forward to a good meal, but it was pretty bad. 

Started with the pancetta wrapped shrimp.  Way overcooked, the tails were charred.  We could barely see or taste the pancetta and it was kind of rubbery due to being cooked way too long.  

For entrees we ordered the lamb chops and the pork chop, which the server recommended.  I ordered the lamb chops rare and they came out medium to medium well.  I find when the more lamb is cooked the more gamey it tastes, hence why I order it rare.  It was overcooked and gamey tasting.  The pork chop which was pounded flat, battered and fried, could have been good, but it had this cloyingly sweet sauce on it.  I think they were going for a savory sweet thing, but the sauce was so sweet it overpowered the dish.  The bread and the creamy polenta, which came with both orders were the best part of the meal.  The wine, an italian red, was good too.

The service was just ok.  The man who greeted us could have been nicer and more welcoming.  Our server was nice enough.  One complaint, she dropped of the dessert menus and we were actually thinking of ordering a desert to share, but she took so long to come back, we decided against it.  For $150, we expected a better meal and more attentive service.

Maybe we should have ordered pasta.  I watched other tables that ordered pasta and it looked good.  Unfortunately our meal wasn't.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
My wife and I ate here before a concert (2014) at the Masonic.  Just a short walk from Venticello to the venue.

From the service to the food, this is a wonderful place for a romantic evening. The pasta and fish were excellent.  I plan to come back soon!
author: Russell D.

description:
We were staying at The Fairmont so searched yelp for local restaurants in Knob Hill and came across Venticello.  It had lots of great reviews so we decided to try it.  It was very busy and had a good energy in the restaurant.  However one of my biggest issues with food quality is how quickly it arrives.  Our food was on the table very fast.  Some people like this so it could be a plus for the restaurant.  It also seemed like a place that had a lot of locals that frequent the restaurant so they are probably prepared each night to serve their regulars.  Another reason I don't like my food to arrive really quickly is I like to enjoy my glass of wine before my meal arrives too.   

I had the cioppino and my partner had the Gnocchi.  The Cioppino was good but not great.  The Gnocchi was okay in comparison to what we have had in the past.   The wine was delicious and service was great.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Took Bart from Fremont to Powell then cable car to Nob Hill and a short walk to
this wonderful, cozy, corner Italian eatery!  They also own Nob Hill Cafe which we
hear is great...but no resers.  Tried lots of items on the menu...all perfect amundo!!
And wonderful service.
author: Carol W.

description: Albeit close to what my be considered "too touristy" as it is right at the top of Nob Hill, this still feels like a small, warm and romantic neighborhood spot. The service was excellent and fast. The food was delicious- we tried the gnocchi al fungi and the fettuccine. And to end the night we had the chocolate torte...out of this world. I would definitely come back for a special occasion.
author: Derek S.

description:
Food and atmosphere at dinner were outstanding.  Service was horrible.  Hence 3 stars.  

We really liked the neighborhood feel of this place, along with the great view, open windows, and cable cars nearby.  

However, we got a bad vibe from our server from the onset.  He seemed completely dismissive of my wife and I during the entire meal.  When taking our drink order, we were deciding between a couple wine options.  Apparently the 8-10 seconds of decision time from us was way too long for him.  He literally walked off, not saying anything, as I was in mid-sentence and didn't return for 5 minutes.  

My wife and I looked at each other with a "what just happened" look.  I initially felt like getting up and leaving right away, but figured I'd just roll with it, but his attitude remained during our entire dinner...never saying anything more than required answers when we ordered, never returning to our table to ask how our food was, if we wanted more drinks, etc.  We originally wanted to order dessert, but were so put off by his attitude that we decided to go elsewhere.  So he finally dropped off the check with a "hear ya go".  Again, no "thanks for coming", "have a nice night", anything.  I get that people can be in a bad mood, and I'm usually tolerant of that stuff...but his overall demeanor and manner were way over the top and very noticeable.  

All that said:  the food was great.  Prosciutto-wrapped chicken was wonderful.  Pasta with bolognese sauce was fantastic.  

Too bad that an incredibly rude server can dampen what should have been a great experience, because everything else was excellent.
author: Jeff D.

description: The most disgusting filet mignon I've ever been served in my life! And manager or chef never came to the table to apologize
author: Timothy G. F.

description:
Went on a Monday night based on Yelp reviews. 

The ambience, food, and service were all excellent. 

The restaurant is small, but the architecture and interior design make it seem much larger. 

The food was excellent. We started with an appetizer and ended with dessert and every course was perfect. 

Our waiter was attentive but not intrusive which just made the evening more delightful. (Ask for Chris)
author: Bob K.

description: My boyfriend and I went here seeking a delicious, romantic dinner, and that's just what we got at Venticello. From the mozzarella and prosciutto crostini appetizer to the crab risotto to the spicy sausage pizza and spaghetti carbonara, each dish was full of flavor. But the best part of this place is the ambiance - tucked away on the corner of Taylor and Washington with views of the bay bridge, the restaurant is cozy, with dim lighting and an open fire oven for their tasty pizzas. I'd definitely go back to try their Gorgonzola and pear pizza and tiramisu - we were too stuffed to try them ! As it was fleet week, we even got a partial view of the firework show from our table by the window. All around lovely evening at this place.
author: Claire C.

description:
I love this cozy, romantic and very rustic atmosphere inside of the restaurant. I got there 10 minutes earlier for my reservation, and I was the first one to get there.
The server seemed a bit snobbish, but still nice. 
We ordered carbonara which was disappointed. First bite and taste was like ramen...just because they use fresh home made noodles, but still wasn't that delicious than I expected. Desert was great! Ordered tiramisu and chocolate torte with raspberry sauce. I could come back here for tiramisu!!
author: Asato T.

description:
I'll keep this short. Came here for a pre-Valentine dinner and these were my highlights:

- A lot of "Lolos and Lolas" up in here
- Two tables that were seated after us got their food before us
- Server must have known we we were irritated so he offered us Tiramisu free of charge
- Food was NOT delicious and certainly not worth the price we paid

Service was lousy. I will never come back here again and can't understand why this place is rated so high.
author: Diana M.

description:
More like a 3.5 for me overall. 

Walked in. Wasn't greeted right away even though we has 2 waitresses walk past us twice. 

The food was good. I wouldn't say fantastic other than my spaghetti carbonara. (So good) we started out with the meatball of the day. They were ehh for me. My boyfriend said that they were the best meat balls he's ever had. I'm pretty sure they were lamb. 

My spaghetti carbonara was the only amazing thing i tried there. Also got the baby artichokes they were good but could have used a bit more flavoring to them. 

Ambiance I give a 5 
Wine I give a 4
Food I give a 3.5
Service I give a 3
author: Kate T.

description: Small yet inviting. Just around the corner of your typical SF crazily steep streets. For appetizer, I tried the meatball which was okay. Me and my friend, we shared Gnocchi. It's tasty but I wasnt impressed. For entree, I got the lamb shank, which was amazing. Its very juicy and tender and meat was loosely attached to the bone. Yum. The restaurant was packed on the weekday around 630PM. Our waiter was not prompt and rarely checked on us. But we weren't so bothered since the food was pretty good. Will I come back? Hmm not sure. SF has too many great restaurants and I would like to explore as many as possible.
author: S C.

description: Had high hopes for this place but it was underwhelming. It said it was Romantic but it was loud. Just the patrons enjoying themselves. The gnocchi was pasty. The Filet mignon was superb. The martini was great the vodka tonic was okay. The tiramisu was great the apple crostata was okay. See my point?
author: Nutan C.

description: Top notch food and service. The perfect place to grab a bite before a show at the Masonic. Great wine list too.
author: Mimi J.

description:
What a cute romantic little restaurant in Nob Hill. We took a cab up here as parking seems to be a bit of a challenge around this area.

The hubs' colleagues chose this place and we had a large party of 12 people. Food was excellent and service was great. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the cozy romantic atmosphere. Definitely a great date place!
author: Betty C.

description:
Kale salad was boring and overpriced. The pizza dough was lacking salt, more like a flatbread than Neapolitan pizza. The tomato sauce was flavorless and the price was not justified.
The ambiance was nice.
author: Maurizio P.

description: Fresh and delicious Italian food, and a very intimate, upscale restaurant. My boyfriend and I celebrate our anniversary there every year. Parking is the only reason it doesn't get 5 stars....Mostly because depending on the time of day, parking can take longer than the time you'll be enjoying your meal. I would definitely take a cab from a garage for our next visit. Also, if you're under 35, you will be among the youngest in the restaurant. BUT its excellent food, and a nice 'special occasion' place to dine.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Really nothing bad to say about this place.

Were easily seated for our reservation and waited on in a timely manner. Our waiter was very knowledgable and able to help us with different wines and items on the menu.

The ambiance is very warm and cozy with the cable car passing outside every couple of minutes.

Drinks were great- as promised. Classic Cosmo, lemon drop martini, and a manhattan. Wine was also great based on a recommendation from our waiter instead of going with our traditional pick of a Pinot noir.

Barrata and dungenous crab was excellent, the Gorgonzola and pine nut pizza was one of the lightest and greatest wood fire pizzas we have tasted, and the Cesar salad was a classic that was well executed.

For the main courses we had the scallops, whole roasted branzzine, and the red snapper. All were amazing. The fish were cooked to perfection. The sides were also heavenly with polenta, asparagus and a kale mix.

desert was even more of a spectacle. We're were able to snag the last apple crisp, and also indulged ourself too sea salt Carmel chocolate cake and tiramisu. 

Left feeling so full we could barely walk up the steep hill but so happy. Service was great, the location is perfect, and the food was memorable.
author: Kelsey W.

description: From the service to the food, this is my favorite restraunt on the west coast. My girlfriend and I have been going to venticello for 3 years now and have yet to be disappointed. It's a date night special!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
two words: food heaven.
It's amazing. Decently priced. i would say the only expensive things are the drinks. The service is great. We originally came without a reservation and was told there was a 45 minute wait, but after taking one look at the pace. We knew this place was something special.
