We went for a brief drink at the Big 4 Restaurant and came back. Bread was delicious. Appetizers were amazing. Drink was perfect and the pasta tasted like something your grandma would make, like that favorite dish of yours that just soothes the soul. After a hectic day of moving, this was the perfect end. My only regret is that I wish we would have found this place sooner. I can not recommend this place more! So so so great!
author: Jasmine N.

description: Came here yesterday with friends. The decor and atmosphere was nice - we sat by the window and it felt very cozy and relatively romantic. The food was good. I really liked the Gorgonzola pizza with arugula . And the eggplant with marinara sauce was nice. Other than that, nothing too memorable. It was a bit more upscale compared to nob hill cafe which is their sister restaurant.
author: Wendy K.

description: We came here for our 11th anniversary, it was just perfect. High ceiling, beautiful elegant, yet cozy atmosphere. Foods we order, my husband ordered lack of lamb. I ordered seafoods stew, both are made to perfection. I asked a waiter to pick wine for me, he picked excellent choice. We were so full that couldn't order the dessert, but if they had Creme Brûlée I would have!
author: Kumi R.

description:
Venticello is very small, but cozy and intimate. Great atmosphere and friendly servers.

The food was fantastic, with great wine selections. My favorite of the meal was this meatball appetizer, which I'm surprised no one is talking about. It was absolutely the bomb. It's these really big tender juicy meatballs in this sauce (I think there are 3 of them, or maybe we ordered 3). Amazing. I highly recommend it, although I'm not sure what it's called. For dessert, everyone raves about the tiramisu but I think the flour-less chocolate cake was to die for. 

Overall, simply a great dinner and an awesome restaurant. I highly recommend it.
author: Nan L.

description: My fiancé and I have been coming here for 10 years. The wait staff and bar tenders are so attentive and the prices are very reasonable. Ambience is romantic but not uncomfortably fancy. Highly recommend for date night and special occasions. (Get the cioppino!!)
author: Allyana W.

description: The concierge at our hotel recommended this neighborhood gem to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  We had drinks at the Top of the Mark and then walked about 3 blocks to Venticello.  We were seated at the corner window table and our wait person was very attentive and helpful with our choices.  We ordered a wonderful 2010 Brunello and asked for it to be decanted.  I started with the evening special - a fabulous burrata, heirloom tomato and arugula salad with a balsamic dressing, and Jim had the tasty carrot soup.  The focaccia bread and EVOO/balsamic was delicious!  My main course was the risotto with shrimp and tiny squid, Jim had the chicken saltimbocca.  The risotto was great and Jim enjoyed the chicken but said it was a bit too salty.  I topped off my dinner with zabaglione, which had the perfect texture of custard.  The meal was memorable and if I lived in San Francisco I would put it at the top of my list.
author: Jann A.

description:
Venticello is the kind of place you'll feel at home. The food is rich, and the people are super warm and welcoming. It may be my new favorite place in the city.

 Being the last ones in the restaurant on a Monday night (an hour before they closed) had the potential to be really awkward. Sometimes you feel totally rushed and guilty being the last people in a restaurant. Not at Venticello! Our server assured us that we were more than welcome, and he was glad to have the company. I loved this! 

I also loved the wine list, the gnocchi (oh god, so good!), and the desserts. My tiramisu was light and fluffy with incredible flavors, the balance between the mascarpone and espresso was perfect. It was the kind of dessert I absolutely did not want to share. Luckily it was my birthday, so I didn't have to :-) 

I really don't see how this place could be "too cozy". Venticello is seriously some of the finest customer service I've ever experienced.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Venticello is one of Nob Hill's prime date restaurants - it's almost as if it was purposely designed to provide an intimate setting. The ambiance is rustic, cozy, classy and superfluously romantic. So men, if you need to charm a lady friend, definitely consider dinner at Venticello.  

The food is very traditional Italian with your typical pastas, Italy-influenced meat courses and great wine. I highly recommend starting off with the Grilled Prawns wrapped in Pancetta with Spicy Chili Sauce - it's definitely a one of a kind, must-try app and the spicy sauce takes it to the next level. Then order the Herb and Goat Cheese Ravioli and the Seafood Risotto for your main courses - they are cheesy without being overpowering, flavorful and extremely well cooked. If you're into something more meaty, I really enjoyed the pork chop - it's flavorful, fattening and juicy. However, the real highlight of the meal is the Tiramisu - it's the perfect way to conclude the night. 

I highly recommend making reservations ahead of time as the restaurant isn't that large and tends to get its Fridays and Saturdays booked up a couple of weeks in advance. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
We hit this place up in the hopes of some quality food and wine before a concert that we were going to, and we were really pressed for time. Because of this, we asked to get seated at the bar and if we could order food there - they were very accommodating, and once we ordered a substantially expensive bottle of wine .. even more so!

We got two pizzas, again, with the intention of saving time but really a few of their entrees looked scrumptious on paper! The service was polite, quick and efficient, we were in and out in just the right amount of time to make it to our show in time.

Would definitely be back. Especially since the cosy, romantic atmosphere adds just a little bit of magic to the night
author: Tasha S.

description: So glad we found this place in San Francisco while visiting for 2 days. It was exactly what I could ask for in an Italian restaurant, great wine list, amazing food, phenomenal service, and a warm relaxing atmosphere. While eating we overheard a couple tell another couple that they had found the best restaurant in the city. We took the cable cars to the restaurant from union square and it was the ultimate tourist experience for a night out for dinner. We were on our honeymoon and it was the most romantic night for our last evening in the city thanks to this place!  Highly recommended if looking for a romantic delicious Italian dinner
author: Lacie S.

description:
Second time at Venticello's, and I think the second time solidified it into my rotation of places to dine.
A VERY San Francisco experience - perfect dinner spot post drinks at the Fairmont or The Big 4 Restaurant. 
We were seated about 20minutes past our reservation time as the restaurant was busy and diners were lingering after paying their check (what the server said). The table for two was the best of the house, overlooking the Bay Bridge. 
Once seated service was great, and food was fantastic. Server happily offered me half orders of the duck pappardelle  and carbonara to complete my meal because I could not make up my mind. I regret no sticking with the full order of the carbonara; it was delicious!! Meatball appetizer was nothing special, as were the salads. All the pastas and pancetta wrapped shrimp were the highlight of the night, with no room for dessert. 
Will happily return for the food.
author: Le O.

description:
For food it is great and the location and the environment is nice. The strange service amazed me.

The  server took only a little time to serve me and because of the flavor my hunger increased .

The staff showed great courtesy before us an it really impressed along with the tasty food.
author: Bernadett S.

description:
Great ambiance, good service, and great food. 

I had the ravioli and my husband had the lamb, both were very good. We started off with the arancini and they were amazing.

Definitely have a reservation for there are only a few tables and we still waited 20 minutes.
author: Jaclyn D.

description: Another great evening at this restaurant! Great service from time we walked in to the time we finished our evening.  Went with pasta shrimp special and organic chicken dish this evening! Both great!
author: Steve F.

description: The food was amazing, the service was excellent but our entire night was ruined due to a horrible interaction with one of the other customers that kept asking to open the backdoor and being verbally abusive to the rest of the guests. The manager was asked for on 5 different occasions and he did nothing to ask them to leave. After the rude guest departed, the entire restaurant clapped! That's adjust the worst restaurant management I have ever seen. The manager decided to sacrifice the entire restaurant worth of bad reviews on one 4-top being absolutely rude. He should have asked them to leave the restaurant immediately, especially for a restaurant of that caliber. Will not be going back here with so many other choices in the city. Do not want that experience again
author: Reza F.

description: I had the gnocchi and it was fantastic. We also had the salted caramel gelato, and it was great The staff are friendly, and the atmosphere is cozy.  I will definitely dine here again.
author: Dustin M.

description: We went there for New Year's Eve and had a great early (prix fixe) dinner.  Seamus was wonderful!  The bisque and gnocchi were to die for!
author: S D.

description: The restaurant did not dissapoint! Very romantic and nice. Located in a neighborhood, this restaurant solidifies why I love San Francisco so much. Our waiter was Tim and he was awesome!  Definitely coming back. I left my heart in San Francisco!
author: Victor V.

description: Free bread with meal. Bottle of water will cost $8 if you don't ask for tap. Relatively small portion sizes but delicious food. Their spicy fennel sausage was to die for in the fettuccine pasta. My friends liked the pizza as well.
author: Matt R.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood and went here at the suggestion of a friend. Loved it so much returned the next night. Had the pizza special and the bruschetta   
Service was friendly 
Going to take tonight off, but
author: Jeff S.

description:
Cramped small restaurant.

My Rack of lamb was soso and the veggies burned.
Service was good but we would not return.

Gould probably 50 people and tables are clods together.
author: Ron M.

description:
Great pasta. Good service. 
Very cute little italian restaurant. The sausage and tomato cream fettuccini was outstanding. 
The fish dish was just ok. But mainly because it wasn't really something I would order anyways anywhere. 

Nice waitress and very nice host. 
For 2 people entree only and 1 drink per person was $75ish.
author: Dakin G.

description: Celebrated my Aunt's 75th Birthday.  The food was authentic Italian cuisine and the service was excellent!!!!  Would go back in a heart beat.  Highly recommend especially for a special occasion.
author: mary f.

description:
Very disappointing.  

The inside of the restaurant is very romantic and has a wonderful ambiance.  The moment we walked in I was very happy with our choice to eat here.  That excitement was sadly, short lived.  

The food was blah, the service was double blah, and the drinks made the Cheesecake Factory look like The Alembic. 

If you are looking for a low key, authentic italian restaurant I recommend you skip this place - try Da Flora (amazinggg) instead.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
Came here on a Thursday around 8pm and the restaurant was about half full.  But after we seated, people started to come in.....The restaurant is pretty small, so reservation is a must during busy hours.  

The atmosphere of the restaurant is really romantic, dark and intimate.  It is a great place for a date.

My friend and I shared the roasted whole portobello Mushroom over soft Polenta 
as the appetizer.  OMG it was so good.  The mushroom was perfectly cooked.  Good flavor.  

For entree, I got the Ahi Tuna with rosemary pepper crust over buttered spinach.  It was very good.  The tuna was fresh and flavorful.  The portion was perfect.

My friend got the grilled pork chop.  It was very good too.  The pork was tender, juicy and flavorful.  

Too bad that we both were too full for dessert......

The service was excellent here.  Everyone was so professional.  Our server was so sweet, friendly, attentive and helpful.  

Overall, I had a really good time at Venticello.  A definitely a good place for a date.
author: Liza T.

description:
A nice option on Nob Hill.  Cozy bar.  Two levels in a comfortable, relatively quiet space with a good vibe.

The beet salad as an appetizer is good.  The pork cutlet on top of potatoes is outstanding.  Good thin crust pizza.  One can easily have a full meal or something lighter and it works.

The service is attentive and professional.  A welcome and warm place in this part of town.
author: William T.

description:
How does a trained chef working in an upscale restaurant allow a slew of dead mussels to leave the kitchen? Those things were shut tighter than Taylor Swift's legs at a Jonas brothers concert. Throw in one piece of crab meat and a shrimp, two clams, and a serving of broth that could barely cover the bottom of the bowl, and you've got Venticello's $23 cioppino.

Coupled with our server's dreaded "It's Friday, I'd rather be doing shots with my betches in Russian Hill" attitude, this place was a big disappointment.

The only highlight of the meal was hearing the guy in the 3 piece suit next to me mutter to his wife, "This ragu sucks."
author: Nick P.

description:
Came here in between back-to-back Giants games against the Dodgers. The concierge at our hotel suggested it. For $84.00, here's what we got: glass of wine, split portabella mushroom antipasti, split Ceasar salad (the best I've ever had) and two entrees, split dessert.  My spaghetti carbonara was to kill for.

Loved it and will be back. 

I should say, we got there really early on a Saturday night. If you're dining during peak hours anywhere in San Francisco, you take your chances. Go eat early and then go do something else. Your dining experience will be better.

I loved my meal here.
author: Margaret K.

description:
That couple sitting next to us was straight out of the Sopranos.  Very attractive young couple though.

Server was a bit snobbish.  
Order the chicken.

Take your Italian girlfriend here.  She will appreciate the effort.

Quaint, stylish, and utterly Italian.  One of the finest Italian places in the city.
author: Kanishk P.

description:
Venticello is super charming and cozy. The decor is stylish and the dim light gives the place a nice touch.

The food itself is just ok, far from being great. When you think italian you except tastes and aromas popping out your plate, and that didn't happen here, at least not on my Risotto Alla Fave, which was really tasteless. Maybe their specialty are pizzas, so guess I can give a second try since the service was good.
author: Gisele M.

description: A traditional Italian menu is offered with excellent wines. The food is full of flavor and the presentation is excellent, but fear not, you will not go hungry. I would strongly recommend this place for a date as it has quite an intimate feel to it & at the same time I would suggest that it is less suitable for groups. It seemed very busy on a midweek night with people queuing outside for a table which is generally a good sign. Not for one looking for a cheap night out.
author: Barry O.

description: One of the worst service experiences in recent or long-term memory. We were seated at a table by the door - where there simply should not be a table at all. Lots of traffic that interrupted our meal - especially by white hair patrons in jackets who put the 's' in snob hill. Our waiter's attitude was no different. Very unwelcoming and aloof. After ordering our food and drinks, we had to ask 15 minutes later for our bread, and even later for our wine. This waiter should visit other restaurants in SF - like Trattoria Da Vittorio - if they want to learn what welcoming people and great service is supposed to be about!  The food was good (not great), but overall a bad dining experience for the price.
author: W. W.

description: So far my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.   The food, service and atmosphere are perfect.   Love the location in Nob Hill in a quiet neighborhood.
author: Enola D.

description:
I hosted my husband, a lifelong old friend and 2 preteens last week. I am in the restaurant business (been training fine dining service and opened restaurants all over the world for a couple of decades...) and my husband is a chef...the food was pretty good but I was underwhelmed by the service. And that is a shame because I really wanted to enjoy this evening out. Our server was Aurelie. The main issue I had was that I got the impression either (A) she did not want to serve us or (2) she just plain didn't want to be there. Why? Because a few times when I asked about an item that was ordered but didn't show up (the meatball appetizer, which I asked for after the salads were delivered and eaten, or another glass of wine for my friend - and I had to ask rather than it being offered) - she didn't say, "Oh, I'll be right back with that, I'm sorry" or anything like that, rather I got some attitude and a dismissive "I'm bringing it". Never did she smile or make eye contact. She looked right past me. Maybe because she didn't think I was the host...? Anyway I spent $315 and ONLY because I used to wait tables did I give her good tip - $75 to be exact. Trust me - had we been given good service I would have tipped more. Usually you tip according to service but truthfully I did not want to further contribute to her sour mood. But I am writing this review and I hope she finds some peace and happiness in doing what she's doing or find something else to do. I loved serving others but not everyone does, I guess.

Oh...and after reading other reviews, I noticed we never got any bread either. Small detail but that's what servers are supposed to do, take care of details, yes? And in my opinion, every detail counts when you are paying that kind of money for an experience.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
In 2 words- FOOD POISONING!!! 
After reading all the great reviews (?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?) I really had my expectation high! Not only was the food DISGUSTING (regardless to the poisoning itself), they were rude enough to tell us over the phone that "nobody else complained about having any problems with the food" so they have no intentions of giving us our money back!!!! 
And all of that- after they were informed about what had happened...
24 hours of throwing up non stop (plus a visit to the ER)!
STAY AWAY!!!! My worst food-relating experience ever!!!!
author: Einat L.

description: Great ambience, cuisine, and service!   We started with a shrimp wrapped bacon starter on a bed of arugula and a hint of chili that was perfect.  Our waiter Christian was very helpful and paced our meal with extraordinary care.   The pizza dough was light and tasty and was topped with mushrooms and fennel sausage.   The papparedelli pasta was al dente just the way we like it and the duck ragu sauce that was amazing..   We shared the fish special that night, the mahi mahi in a pesto sauce with green been shoots that was flaky and perfectly prepared.  This is one of the best restaurants we have visited in SF.
author: David K.

description:
Built up my calf muscles on the hilly way to the restaurant -- part of the fun!  

Been here a few times, and the food has been consistently good.  Their pappardelle was particularly memorable.  The ambience is nice:  it's on the formal side, but not stuffy.
author: Bay Area Explorer X.

description: Came here on the recommendation of a friend and colleague. He said it was the best Italian in San Francisco, and although I have not sampled all competitors, this place is at the top of my list. All around win here.
author: Mark C.

description:
I asked the concierge for a romantic restaurant to have our wedding night dinner for two, and couldn't have fantasized a more perfect evening. I requested ahead of time to be seated at one of the two window tables and to our delight they were able to accommodate us.
 
We were immediately greeted by the bartender who congratulate us on our nuptials, and informed us there was Prosecco on ice awaiting our arrival. We were taken to our requested table and granted an unobstructed view of the city night-scape with the Golden Gate Bridge as its backdrop. It was absolutely stunning! We watched pedestrians bundled in winter wear walking their dogs (it was the night before Thanksgiving), and listened to the steady hum of laughter and holiday conversation behind us. 

We were reluctant to request only one plate of each course, but we'd been nibbling and sipping all day; we'd just gotten married.  I believe it to be a direct reflection of the professionalism of the staff that our waiter realized our menu questions, aside from being vegetarian based, were all related to portion sizes. Without hesitation he suggested vegetarian options and then offered to have each course split for two. 

We ordered the soup of the day, a pumpkin and soft cheese concoction (?) that was creamy and richa and hinting of just enough spice. We then had grilled tiger prawns, pancetta, and spicy chili sauce, which we used as the salad course, followed by the Gnocchi Al Funghi; potato dumplings, mushroom cream, gorgonzola...oh my. I tried to muffle the sounds of delight escaping my control, but my wife's sounds of pleasure were equally as audible. Our waiter was pleased, as were we.  We were going to order the Tiramisu, but to our surprise, were gifted the Torta Di Cioccolata, a slice of rich chocolate heaven. 

Along with the food, which I felt was exceptionally good and true to the atmosphere, the staff was attentive without being overbearing. We were given the time to enjoy our meal with conversation and appreciation of the view, while being  greeted individually by the manager and other staff members, each coming to congratulate us with glasses of Prosecco. 

Ready to sit back and rub our new 'Buddha- bellies', one of the waiters announced to the tables nearest ours, that we had just wed that day...for the first time in my life I refused more Prosecco...

It was a fabulous meal in a beautiful setting created by an established kitchen and wait staff. 

Grazie Venticello!
author: Natalie B.

description:
I came here with a group of co-workers. I liked the cozy and intimate setting.. 

We ordered a eggplant and the prawns for appetizer..all 4 plates quickly vanished. 

I had the Veal for my main dish...it was excellent. 

The only bummer about our dining experience was that we had originally had a reso for 6 ppl, but showed up with 8. They were only able to accommodate 7 of us..so one of our compadres graciously bowed out...it would have been great if they could have done something to accommodate the one extra person.
author: Mimi T.

description: Such a cozy lovely restaurant in the heart of nob hill. We were lucky to get the table with ghe view of the bay bridge. Food is amazing as is the wine list. Super romantic and one of my favorites.
author: PM L.

description: I love this restaurant, and it's a double bonus having it in my hood! I took a girlfriend out for a catch-up dinner and we had no reservation but they found room for us right away. Our waitress was attentive but still gave us plenty of time to chat. The food was DELISH.  I wish I ordered my friend's dish, black-ink risotto. It was so good! I recommend this place for a date night or a small dinner party.
author: Elaine C.

description:
I was excited at first when my friend made reservations at Venticello for dinner because I jog past this restaurant all the time and every time I kept making a mental note that I had to try. Now the only thing I will think when I go by it is disappointment. 

The wine I ordered here was delicious but it was the way the bartender made feel that really put a damper on my night. 

I got there early waiting for my friend to arrive and I went to sit at the bar and the bartender looked at me and served me as if he thought I couldn't pay or afford it! His demeanor was horrible towards me. There were two business men next to me and he was super pleasant to them. I have thick skin and it takes a lot to make feel uncomfortable or awkward. 

My friends and I are foodies. We enjoy fine dining and I have never had this happen to me...EVER.

Once my friend arrived and we moved to a table the rest of the night was fine and the actual server was great. 

I ordered the gnocchi and it was too salty for my liking but the food is not the reason why I will not return. 

+1 star for nice decor
+1 star for the attentive food server
author: Lidia Z.

description:
Starving from not eating the gross catered work lunch, a 7:45 reservation was later than I would have preferred, but when the boyfriend finally takes initiative and makes a dinner reservation you go, no matter what time it is.  We arrived at 7:40 and were told by the pleasant bartender/host/social butterfly that it would be just a few minutes and we could wait outside as it was rather stuffy indoors.  Outside we went, for 27 minutes (yes, I was counting).  Recognizing our irritation (read: starvation) we were offered a complimentary glass of wine and a spot at the bar until our table was ready.  I must say, this changed the game for me. The simple acknowledgement of a frustrating situation by the bartender quite literally changed my view of the restaurant and made my night that much more enjoyable.  Finally seated, we enjoyed a second glass of Pinot and the kale salad.  My boyfriend had the fish (LOTS of bones but he loved it anyway) and I had the margherita pizza.  The pizza crust was the most delicious I have had a in a long time, soft center, rustic crusty edges - the type that you could eat the whole thing but you don't want to look like a heifer in front of your man so you stop halfway though and pretend you are full.    

Venticello is definitely a great date/work dinner spot and a great Nob Hill gem.  If you're heading there for a first date, steer clear of the fish unless your date likes you pulling fish bones out of your mouth after every bite.
author: Kate E.

description: May have been an off nite as server mentioned there were computer issues with orders going in . Seriously ? We got seated at the time of our reservation . Vibe is nice . Service was relatively inattentive throughout evening which became irritating over time . Kale salad was enjoyed by my wife but my grilled prawns were awful and dry and tiny and something you would  get at Costco. Fish stew was tasty and duck ragu pappardelle was also good but the pace of dinner was off . Waitress made effort to offer a free dessert but wish dinner had been better . Would go to Nob Hill cafe next time up the street .
author: Maine D.

description:
We went here for Valentine's day with the pre-set menu and were less then impressed. We waited 45 minutes to be seated for our reservation after being told that it would be "just a minute, they are finishing up now". I heard the host say this to everyone who walked through the door and most people were waiting just as long as us, if not longer. Arrogant host. All told we were at the restaurant for 3 hours and our server basically forgot about us for 30 to 40 minutes at a time. The food, like the service, was less than stellar. My steak was over cooked  my girlfriend's halibut was way too salty. 

The most enjoyable part of the night was waiting for our table with a glass of wine at the bar... which should have taken 15 minutes at most... not 45. You would think a place like this would bring it's "A" game on V-day... First and last trip to Venticello.
author: Harry A.

description: This was the best Italian food we had outside of Italy! This restaurant is in a cute little neighborhood of the city and the restaurant itself has a very intimate & cozy ambiance. Ideal for a date night. The food was very flavorful and between the two of us, we shared  the Roasted Eggplant, Margherita Pizza and the Gnocchi. The eggplant & the pizza were amazing, very fresh & full of flavor! I thought the gnocchi was not that great, the sauce had a smoky flavor to it, it was still fine, just not great. The Tiramisu was out of the world and the wine was great too! We thoroughly enjoyed the meal and it helped that they brought one portion after the other. We had no leftovers! Overall, the whole experience was very enjoyable!
author: Preeti P.

description: stumbled on the neighborhood restaurant several years ago and it was such a great find. Since then my husband and I have been here a few times and have never been disappointed. The food is great and so is the service. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Elzabeth G.

description: Incredible service - Tim can work a room. Order the meatball special of the day, the beet salad and try a few different pasta dishes. Fun, yet romantic. A buzzing comfortable atmosphere.
author: Vicki L.

description:
This tiny restaurant is cozy.  Nice place for a dinner for two.  
The service was good, but I would like to eat out in a nice place just once in SF without being waited on by people with facial piercings and visible tattoos. 

It was uncomfortable waiting for our table, because there is absolutely no place to wait in this restaurant.  You end up standing directly inside the door, in the way of the staff going from the kitchen to the dining room.  This also means there is no place to wait after your meal for a cab or for the person driving in your party to get the car and pick you up.

This place is in Nob Hill and they do not have valet parking.

The host was very sweet and even introduced us to the couple dining at the table next to us.  That made it easier to handle the fact that the tables are too close together.  The folks next to you are going to hear every word of your conversation, and vice-versa, so you might as well greet each other.

It was strange that the host made a point of telling us we were getting the "view" when this restaurant really doesn't have one.  

The food was OK.  I had the eggplant appetizer and lamb shank.  The eggplant was in a bowl with way too much tomato sauce.  There were odd unidentifiable ingredients in the orzo that accompanied the lamb shank that should have been identified on the menu.  These are minor complaints.  I didn't leave hungry, but I would not be in any hurry to return here.

My friend liked her Manhattan so much that she ordered a second one.  I didn't see a bartender, but whoever made it must have done a good job.

We were too full for dessert, but the woman at the next table described the tiramisu to her husband as "ridiculous."  She meant this as a compliment and told the host it was the best tiramisu she had ever had.
author: Bay G.

description:
Love this place. Good for business dinners and date night.
Good wine list and the pasta is amazing.
Never had a bad time or bad meal here.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I have to say that the restaurant was very nice, but could use a few minor tweaks to stand out....

The appetizers - AMAZING!  The bruschetta was to die for and the mushrooms on top had an amazing smoky flavor.  NOTE: I normally will not even eat a mushroom, but my friend insisted on ordering it, and I could honestly eat this everyday now.  The other appetizers we ordered were just as spectacular.

Main course - mine was a seafood dish (name slips me), and honestly I think I forgot the name because it was rather unappealing, and even the presentation was not very flattering.  My friend ordered the filet and seemed to enjoy it, and it did look very nice.

Dessert; orange doughnuts - they were simple and sweet, but instead the sweet dips of chocolate and (I believe it was like a vanilla frosting) - could have been better replaced with side of homewade whipped cream and chocolate - or even a yummy homemade vanilla ice cream.  

I am big on noise level and noise reduction - it was a Tuesday and often I could not hear the friend I dined with seated directly across from me.

Minor detail - CLEAN the windows.  The windows were dirty on the exterior and took away from the nice view of the neighborhood.

OVERALL - I would eat there again, but note that the price is slightly above the norm for SF - our bill exceeded $100 for two and we did not drink wine.
author: Douglas P.

description:
Cute neighbor place. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Found it on a business trip.

Ordered the pasta special an it was great! Homemade noodles. Wonderful pomodoro sauce.
author: Lena J.

description:
Well, what an evening this turned out to be! My boyfriend and I were SUPER excited to come to a nice restaurant and have a lovely, delicious, and romantic dinner for New Year's Eve. Sadly, we were mistaken. 

After waiting a half hour past our reservation time without an apology or complimentary glass of wine we were seated. It then took 20 minutes before a server came over to take our order. She was nice but it seemed like the tables she was taking care of were too spread out, which often left us forgotten. 

The food was not good to put it politely. Everything was either WAY too salty (even dessert), over cooked or undercooked. I love lobster and was really looking forward to that but it was inedible, like I was chewing on rubber. The scallops were the highlight and the Crab ravioli had potential but was a little too al dente. Because it had already been 2.5 hours into our dinner service I didn't want to waste anymore time there by waiting to have it remade. 

I was also shocked that the table sitting next to us arrived 20 minutes after we did and received all of their courses before we received ours. It seemed a bit strange to me. 

Because we were so displeased with the service and were already running late to meet up with friends we took our dessert to go and got out as soon as we could. As much as we wanted to love this place it just seems that they were not prepared for the evening and it didn't make for a pleasant dining experience.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Very pretty restaurant if you sit in the corner table by the window you get a great view of the bay bridge 
I had the shrimp wrapped in bacon ( or pancetta) very good but the chilli sauce was a little spicy for me . For my entree I had herb and goat cheese ravioli - very good . I also had a couple of slices of pear and Gorgonzola pizza very nice but I would have liked a bit more Gorgonzola but I'm a cheese freak ! Tiramisu for dessert was excellent . I would come here again
author: lyn m.

description: Had a wonderful and romantic New Year's Eve dinner. Service and atmosphere are top notch. Small intimate restaurant!
author: Christine M.

description:
Oh my! I lived two blocks away from this place a few years ago and always meant to go but never made it until recently.  I was still all swooning over the food we ate the next day!  My friend and I shared a mushroom arugula pizetta, goat cheese ravioli in garlic, tomato basil sauce, and a beef filet I can't even describe because the deliciousness is beyond me. They have a full bar too, with very friendly, helpful bartenders, and the ambiance is nothing to sneeze at either.  I will be back very very soon! 
***How*** did I never stop in before?
author: Adrienne K.

description:
This is the first review I've written for a restaurant. 

I went to Venticello last night for my wedding anniversary. We told them this was the case when we booked our table.

They really, really made a fantastic effort to make the night special for us. The host was excellent and the waiter we had was unreal. I can't remember service that good for a long time.

No rushing, excellent knowledge of food and wine, happy to have a conversation with us but knew when to stop as it was our anniversary! Just perfect.

Food was great. Real traditional, authentic Italian food. Full of flavour and everything was cooked to perfection

And the cost is excellent. I could not believe the check when it came. Outstanding value.

Quite simple the best meal out I've had in a long time.
author: James L.

description: We had a really excellent meal here, I had the artichoke and lemon ravioli and my husband had the fish soup. Both were excellent, complex and very satisfying flavour combinations. We had a table with a peak of the bridge, and the service was very good, typically Italian. Our waiter did however forget that my husband was gluten free and his fish soup came with two pieces of bread sticking out from it, so worth making this extra clear if you're celiac. Wine was good, very Italian, even the Californian ones, but not a huge selection by the glass, we provably should have plumped for a more expensive whole bottle.  We would definitely recommend and will definitely be back if we are here again!
author: Ruth G.

description: Had our first anniversary dinner here Monday night and the service and food were superb. They recommended a Sangiovese Cabernet Blend 2010 that was exactly as we described what we wanted - dark delicious fruit with soft tannins...pancetta wrapped grilled prawns were fresh and grilled to perfect moistness although a bit salty for our tastes...Champagne had the seafood stew and loved it a great blend of shell and white fish in a perfectly herbed broth and I had the special snapper on spinach and polenta that was cooked to moist perfection. A complementary Tiramisu with a candle topped off the evening with rich decaf cappuccino and Sambucco for Champagne and Woodford Reserve for me.
author: Bourbon And Champagne P.

description: Nice restaurant in a lovely neighborhood. The food was delicious, service could be better. The prices are a bit high for Italian food.
author: Cornelia I.

description: Amazing! My taste buds were exploding with excitement. At the table, we started with a traditional margherita pizza which had the perfect amount of crisp. The Cesar salad was delightful. My entree was the stuffed ravioli with crescenza cheese & Swiss chard and covered in the most delicious bettola sauce. We wanted to bathe   In it! We wrapped up dinner with the chocolate torte topped with warm sea salt. Heaven!
author: Jamie L.

description: I went to meet a friend at this recommended restaurant, for a drink. We were informed by the maître d' that they only had four barstools and they were filled so perhaps we should go to the Huntington down the street.  The tables in the restaurant, were only 20% felt, and the tables by the bar were completely empty. When we asked if we could sit at a small table by the bar we were informed that "this is a restaurant with the bar not a bar with a restaurant."  The maître d' was surly, and, not that it matters, had very poor hygiene. I have only had this experience one other time in my life - I never returned to that restaurant, nor will I ever return to this one, for a drink, meal, or anything else. The irony, of course, is that we went to the Huntington, had drinks, and ordered food as well, as we certainly would have at Venticello without the rude brush off from the management.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Ran in here last night for dinner and was impressed - Mike B described it well as a "cozy little hole in the wall kinda place." Given the weak spot I have for Nob Hill, this was a no-brainer. 

The service was great, the food impressed and this is absolutely somewhere I'd return to explore more of the menu:
-(B) SCAMPI E PANCETTA FRA DIAVOLO Fire Grilled Prawns wrapped in Pancetta with a Spicy Chili Sauce: Great sauce, but the prawns were a bit dry and possibly a little overdone
- (A+) RAVIOLI DI FORMAGGIO AL POMODORO Herb & Goat Cheese Ravioli in a Roma Tomato, Basil & Garlic Sauce: exceptional - highly recommended
-(B+) SCALLOPINE DI VITELLO Sautéed Veal Scallopine with a Flamed Sambucca & Basil Cream Sauce with Tiger Prawns: very good, but underwhelming compared to the Ravioli
-(B) Tiramasu - good, but not great.

Overall, I can't say the food was mind blowing, but I'm convinced we misordered - absolutely recommend trying Venticello.
author: Jeff F.

description:
I cannot say anything about the food because didnt have the chance to eat anything. Since the bald waiter was very rude. I just left! 
REALLY BAD SERVICE!
author: Carol P.

description: Amazing as always.  Quaint atmosphere, attentive service and wonderful food.  Recommend the meatballs, pizza and pappardelle.
author: Justin S.

description: We had our pre-wedding supper on 3/9/2014.  Our table of six shared delicious appetizers of carpaccio and Caesar salad.  Among our meal choices were steak, chicken, fish special, and cippino.  Everything was hot, fresh, and expertly prepared. The ambiance equaled the food.  I suggest making a reservation because it was busy early in the evening on Sunday.
author: Manda R.

description:
We ate here on a recent trip to San Francisco.  It was recommended by the staff at the Fairmont hotel, as it is close by.  Small, but welcoming and I found the staff friendly and helpful.  Most of the tables are down a flight of stairs in a warm room with windows on the street.  We enjoyed the arancini appetizer, which had a delicious crabmeat filling.  Then a huge portion of paper-thin carpaccio, and one of their pizzas.  Pizzas are all made in the wood fired oven in the dining room.  We had the gorgonzola and pear variety - thin crispy crust, very nice.  

Although small, the tables are not crowded and the noise level is totally acceptable - you can actually carry on a conversation with your dinner companions, which I appreciate.  I would not hesitate to recommend this place.
author: Deb R.

description: On a business trip and flying solo, I tried to get into the Nob Hill Cafe but the wait was longer than my patience so they sent me down the road to this little gem, and I am glad they did. I immediately got a seat at the bar at this cozy, warmly lit corner spot. The winter greens salad was more bitter than my preference plus the acid-y dressing put it over the top, a bit. The top crust of the apple crostada was too thick for eating in front of a companion, but I happily chipped and gnawed away at it on my own. The real treasure was the wild boar pappardelle.  Fresh pasta and chunks of succulent wild pig in a rich, dark sauce were the perfect choice for a chilly evening in the City. Thankfully, the friendly maitre d'/waiter/bartender had to make plenty of hikes down the stairs to the lower level so I could lick the bowl clean free of judging eyes.
author: Brooks L.

description:
My family came here to celebrate my graduation and it's a really cute romantic Italian restaurant. The views are great because you're right in Nob Hill. The food was delicious and we had a nice time; however, it's definitely geared for an older crowd.

A couple of things that stand out: Grgich wine, pancetta wrapped filet mignon, carpaccio, and the seared rare ahi tuna.  So tasty!
author: Taylor L.

description:
I hate to rain on this parade, but I'm not sure what the hype is all about.  Yeah it's cute and somewhat romantic...but the food is just eh.  It could be because of what we had, but still with all the rave reviews I expected more.

starters:
CARPACCIO CIPRIANO - the beef was tender, but sliced thicker than I'd like for my carpaccio

CESARE TRADIZIONALE - I like that it is whole romaine lettuce leaf, but the flavor was just eh.

entrees:
SPAGHETTI CARBONARA
FETTUCINE CON SALSICCIA 

Both dishes were salty and just eh.  I admit maybe we should've ordered meat/fish entrees, but you figure it's an Italian place and they should do awesome pastas, right?  Especially when they tout it is homemade...

dessert:
TIRAMISU - this was the best part of the meal.  It is creamy, tasty and I would definitely order this again.

I would give this place another chance, but with so many other yummy restaurants in SF to try and return to... I'm not sure I care to come back to Venticello.
author: Mao K.

description:
The food here is the best. 
Had the lamb medallions and the spaghetti carbonara for the main dish. The lamb was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious. The spaghetti carbonara was amazing. For the first time in my life with this dish, it was the noodles which stole the show, not the sauce. I mean, the sauce was delicious, but those noodles are just wow. 
Started with the soup of the day, mushroom, and the Caesar salad. The mushroom soup was very good, especially when you dipped your fresh soft ciabatta bread in it. The Caesar was standard, but in a "that's how a Caesar salad should be" kind of way. The wine was priced well for the quality. 
Did I mention the staff was perfect? 
All in all, a great meal experience.
author: Katie F.

description:
Free Bread: One of the things I enjoyed most here

Antipasto plate: Good

Ceasar Salad: Okay

Petrale Sole: I enjoyed mine.  Sauce was good.

Gnocchi: Okay

Okay spot but not overall too memorable.  Plus parking here is a PAIN.
author: Ken L.

description: Ordered spaghetti carbonara. Disgustingly salty and distasteful. I never leave such strong reviews about any restaurant but this dish truly warranted this bad review. Felt like the chef salted it twice.
author: Red F.

description:
This romantic Italian restaurant in Nob Hill is worth planning ahead for. The clientele is a mix of young and eager foodies and older couples looking to avoid the louder, hipper Italian joints.

But really, everyone comes here for the menu. My husband was wowed by the pear-and-gorgonzola pizzette as an appetizer. The pears had a sweet fruity taste and held their own against the cheese and a thin, chewy crust. I was less impressed by my minestrone (zucchini, carrots, and spinach in a chicken stock), but the herb bread with garlic and olive oil improved matters considerably. The seafood pasta special caught my attention and my order: penne in a lobster cream sauce with grilled shrimp and Dungeness crab. Decadent as hell, and a generous portion.  Husband got the Salciccia pasta dish, with Italian sausage and a fennel-tomato sauce, and cleaned his plate. 

And, of course, you can't come here and not try the legendary tiramisu. 

With appetizers generally under $10 and most entrees in the $18-25 range, it's a splurge but not a wallet-buster. Just be forewarned that Venticello tacks on a 4% healthcare surcharge to provide insurance for its waitstaff -- a noble goal worth supporting but other places in the city do a flat fee per diner, which seems to make more business sense.
author: M. J.

description: We ate at the bar and the host/maitre d' was our server and we had great service.  The ravioli's were so amazing, they were in a broth made from the rinds of cheese.  Every we ate had really good flavors and we got some great recommendations from the host.  There was a great feel to the restaurant and everyone was so friendly.  We are definitely going back.
author: Joan M.

description:
Went here last night for dinner. I am visiting from Philly with my fiance and rather than getting stuck at all the tourist traps that are down by the water, we decided the past couple days to try some other restaurants.

I tried the filet mignon wrapped in pancetta over potatoes and greens in a reduction. It was very good. Would def recommend it. And their bread with olive oil and fresh garlic is very good.

My fiance got the gnocchi and it was awesome. I would have gotten it if I ever came back to San Fran.

If you are looking for a nice little restaurant that is not too expensive with a great atmosphere, highly recommend Venticello
author: Sean D.

description:
A fiasco.  Anybody can have a bad night, but New Year's Eve for me and my nearest and dearest was ruined by Venticello's food and service.  At least the view of the fireworks over the downtown skyline was nice.

Can't say much for their inability to seat any party within a half an hour of their reservation time, remember anyone's order, bring food to the table while warm, or even make an attempt to mollify the crowd of irate patrons hovering over our table, near the entrance.  Do *not* *ever* eat at this place, particularly if you don't like paying more than $100 per person (without wine) to leave hungry.

If you do enjoy tiny portions of seemingly microwaved food, smarmy service that disappears for eons only to reappear with what you didn't order, and week-old shellfish, this is your place!
author: Vincent L.

description: Wow.  What a gem. Excellent selection, food , wine, top notch service.  I will dm definitely return. Location on top of nob hill pretty cool also.
author: Joe M.

description: Simply Amazing!!!! Go and enjoy then jump on the cable car.  This is SF at it's BEST!
author: Scott P.

description: Been going to Venticello's for years, told friends about it, took eight people each couple had taken their favorite wine, but we were told 2 bottles per table, so if we were all sitting at separate tables each couple could have 2 bottles, we paid $25.00 corkage and ordered a bottle of their wine, but refused to open another bottle of our wine, manager was very rude, we will take our business someplace else, lots of restaurants in San Francisco, would not recommend Venticello's ,
author: Paulette H.

description: I'd never even heard of this place but needed to meet someone close to the Fairmont and this is what I found on Yelp.  What a wonderful well-kept secret!  Our meals were delicious and the service was great.  I had the pappardelle with braised boar - yum.  The black kale salad was also tasty.   We were able to get a reservation same day and while the restaurant was busy, it wasn't too loud or hectic inside.  I will definitely be back.
author: Tina S.

description:
I love venticello! 

If you want to feel like you are in a romantic movie shot in SF and that is not a tourist trap this is the place. Rolling cable car, cute SF hill, amazing staff, beautiful/tasteful build out, classy building and then the food - soooo good. 

I cannot recommend this place highly enough to have a fun romantic date at, take the visiting family to or just hang out with friends in the upstairs bar area - they all work and believe me the owners and managers here will make the extra effort ensure you have a wonderful experience! I am so jealous of the people who are walking distance from venticello - lucky dogs and they do have valet so no need to worry about parking.
author: James H.

description:
Great ambience and amazing food. This was the best spaghetti carbonara I've ever had. The ambience felt authentically Italian. And when we weren't sure what we wanted to drink, the waiter recommended a cocktail that was just great; sadly I don't remember the ingredients.

Absolutely worth the 45 minute wait we had when we walked in without a reservation! Sadly we'll be moving away from San Francisco.
author: Christian B.

description: Romantic spot.  Great for dates.  Food is pretty good.  Service is great.  Manager is awesome.  Carbonara was awesome.  Pasta with chicken was ok - tasted like chicken noodle soup.  Arancini was very good too!  Nice wine list.  Good foccacia.
author: Jordan S.

description:
I WISH I could say that this place is off the hook because it's 1/2 a block from my apartment, but unfortunately I thought Venticello was alright. Although, I must say that the appetizer was amazing. We ordered the baked eggplant with cheese which came out looking and tasting like a lasagna. The Parmesan was fresh, not too oily and the eggplant was cooked perfectly. I started throwing some of the cheese/eggplant onto pieces of my soft and warm ciabatta bread and basically made a delicious pizza :)  I enjoyed it. 

The entrees were the disappointment. They weren't terrible, but there just wasn't anything unique about it. I ordered the Pasta Carbonara. The best part of this dish is the hand made noodles. You can definitely taste the difference. The sauce was creamy and packed with tons of Pancetta which was nice. The dish just wasn't packed with flavor, was sort of bland in my opinion.

My boyfriend had the special which was very healthy and pretty basic -  Rigatoni with heirloom tomatoes and spinach. It was tasty, but I really felt that I could have made that dish at home and I'm not a great cook by any stretch.
author: Kristina W.

description: I live close to this place, and have been several times. It is the best Italian food I've had in Nob Hill. Great service, atmosphere and food every time. Try the veal scallopini. Amazing.
author: Ryan M.

description: A great neighborhood place!  Warm and friendly service from people with passion for delivering  a meal to remember.  The cioppino was excellent but the pleasant surprise of the kale salad stayed with me.  VG wines by the glass as a bonus.
author: Ken L.

description: Very trendy and busy place! We had an excellent dinner with good pinot noir from russian river valley. Service was nice, somewhat impersonal but professional. Price is a little bit on the high end for the food and the service.
author: Pierre A.

description: I took my lovely lady here for our 4 year anniversary.  I stopped by ahead of time and let them know it was a special night.  They helped us reserve the best seat (most private, with a view) in the restaurant, and upon arrival, they brought us glasses of bubbles and wished us a happy anniversary.  The service and food were great.  At the end they brought us delicious dessert with a candle to make a wish.  The great news is that they didn't charge any extra for the bubbles and dessert.  They were just trying to make the night a little more special for us, and I appreciated that.  Great people, great food, and it's reasonably priced for the quality and location.
author: Salar S.

description: We make sure to visit Venticello when we are in the City. Service is excellent. & personal & the food is ALWAYS sensational!  The gnocchi is my personal favorite & every entre I have tried has been delicious
author: Nancy S.

description:
Love this place! I have been here many times and I continue to be impressed.
Service, food quality and flavor, decor all 5 STARS. Best Italian restaurant in the Nob Hill area and among the best for just good Italian food in the City.
author: Robert D.

description: My wife and I almost did not go because a a few bad reviews. If we had skipped this restaurant, it would have been our loss. The GM, Michael, was fantastic and very cordial. The service and the food exceeded our expectations and we had an incredible experience. We went there as customers and left as friends of the staff.
author: Jimmy K.

description: It's an Ok place to have dinner. The tables are very close together and their chairs are uncomfortable. Their staff is very nice and helpful but our waiter unfortunately paired our food with a very expensive bottle of wine that did not match well with our meals. Their food was OK, but you would expect more from this restaurant when you walk by. If you sit in the right chair, at least the view will be good.
author: Ina W.

description:
Spectacular and beautiful restaurant. Venticello sits atop Nob Hill and is tucked away and almost hidden among the residential apartment buildings. The décor is almost like a Tuscany feel, deep reds and light orange/browns. The restaurant itself has a 2 level dining room. Larger parties on the bottom first level for "family style" dining feel with round tables, etc. Doubles upstairs on the 2nd floor. Dimly lit and uber romantic. Too bad my BF and I were super underdressed for our belated 2 month Anniversary dinner post our 2 month Anniversary Spa Day. 

We called in about 6pm and asked if we needed a reservation. The host said that we did not and to just come in. When we got there the host asked for our reservation. We said we didn't have one. He walked away and had a pow-wow of some sort trying to figure out where to seat us. Coldest stare ever. 

We were seated in the "corner" upstairs dining room. We were okay with that seeing as we were in flip flops and sneakers. We were served some bread and some olive oil garlic mixture which was AWESOME. I'd say almost the best part of the meal was it. We shared a cesar salad, an arugula & fungi pizzetta, the herb and goat cheese ravioli and the tiramisu for dessert. All were excellent. The cesar salad wasn't to die for but nice. The pizzetta was quite tasty. The mix between the mushrooms and arugula went well together. The herb and goat cheese ravioli (half helping split between 2 and also divided onto 2 bowls) was a bit overpowering. It was a good idea to split the dish as pasta can get quite heavy. The tiramisu was fantastic. It came with some almond cookies which were the 2nd best part of the meal. I love my carbs. 

4 stars for an awesome romantic meal in flip flops. 2 stars for the walk up those dang hills. 5 stars for a beautiful night out in Nob Hill. Quite possibly one of the nicest neighborhoods that go overlooked.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Really cute spot in a nice location, but the service was awkward and many of the dishes we had were quite bland, including the pizza dough and sauce. Also, I like to think we've moved past the days when dumping a bunch of fresh arugula on a plate is considered culinary know-how.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I needed a nice restaurant within  walking distance to the Masonic theater. I found this place and liked the menu, so I made the reservation for my friends and I. They had valet which rocked and after the meal, our friend was able to arrange a special parking situation with the valet, so we didn't have to worry about not getting out of the show in time. 
Service at the restaurant was attentive. There was one guy though who was a creeper. Kept looking with a scowl and never one responded to us when we thanked him for clearing our table or giving us water. He seemed very displeased with life. Other than him, everyone was super friendly and chatty. The ambiance was awesome, minus the random eyeless mask on the wall! That needs removal ASAP! 
Dim lighting and romantic atmosphere. Definitely a wine place as they only make mixed drinks and not actual cocktails. Since wine makes me fall asleep, I just drank water. Their warm rosemary focacia was to die for! Got two baskets of that. We ordered the spaghetti carbonara without the pancetta and it was killer! I rarely wish my friends were not there so I could have an entire dish to myself. We got the Gorgonzola pizza which was amazing you LOVE Gorgonzola. If not, you will not enjoy as the gorgie flavor is INTENSE!!!! We also shared the Gorgonzola gnocchi which was stellar! SOOOOO YUMMY we literally cleared the plate with our bread to eat the sauce. The only food there that wasn't great, and it's still confusing as to how it wasn't, was the chocolate torte dessert. It tasted like a walnut brownie and had no really chocolaty flavor. Like a muted, walnut brownie. It was odd and none of us liked it. We'd all go back and order it all again, minus the dessert. 
Definitely not crazy expensive so I have no clue why this place gets $$$ as it's $$. The area, the city, and the caliber of the food make it incredibly reasonable. 3 people, 3 dishes and dessert, one alcoholic beverage, all for $70ish. Not bad at all!!!!!!
author: Unicorn U.

description: Great variety of food.  Started with a Charred salad and rolled into grilled Figs. The lamb chops perfectly cooked. Others had steak, pasta and sausage, pork and she'll fish.
author: Scott A.

description:
I liked this warmly-lit restaurant as soon as I opened the door. I found my dinner companion waiting for me at the bar where two glasses of Sparkling Prosecco (Canella, Prosecco di Conegliano, Italia, NV) made a wonderful start to my pre-birthday dinner.

My dinner companion began with the Melanzane Ripiene- Grilled Eggplant Rolls with Ricotta and Mascarpone in a Marinara Sauce. I had the Scampi e Pancetta Fra Diavolo- Fire Grilled Prawns wrapped in Pancetta with a Spicy Chili Sauce. Both were very good and I don't even like eggplant!

For dinner I picked the Filetto Toscano- Sasame & Black Pepper Crusted Filet with Sweet Roasted Shallots. My dinner companion chose the Maiale con Pere E Balsamico- Grilled Pork Tenderloin Medallions over a Pear Relish & Balsamic Rum Syrup. I enjoyed my steak though I could have done with a more robust sauce to enliven it.

For dessert we shared the Zabaione Con Frutta E Biscotti- Sweet custard cream served over fresh seasonal berries and cookies. This was a lovely ending to dinner as the dish was packed with sweet, ripe strawberries.

The only issue that came up with regard to service was that they forgot my tea but still charged us for it. A matter easily rectified.

Overall, a very nice dinner. I look forward to going back soon to sample more from the menu.
author: Miriam W.

description:
My husband and I celebrated our 16th anniversary at Venticello last weekend.  Our concierge at Cavallo Point highly recommended it.

Highlight of the evening - After dinner we left our children's souvenirs under the table.  We were on our way to Cobbs Comedy Club for a 9:45 show, when we discovered what we had left.  We immediately called the restaurant.  Daniel, the host, answered and when it was clear that we would not be able to return to the restaurant before closing he graciously offered to drop off the souvenirs at the comedy club's front office.  That's service!
author: Melissa C.

description: This place is great for food, atmosphere and location.  The service was a bit strange though.  The waiter took our order without taking down notes on a pad, and then returned multiple times because he'd forgotten what we'd ordered.  Two of us ordered the same dessert, and he returned to tell us that dessert was not available, so we had to pick something else. But he only took one person's replacement order before rushing off!  He had to be called back to take the second person's replacement. Just get that man a notepad.
author: Katrina K.

description:
A picturesque hidden gem in the midst of the charming residential neighborhood of Nob Hill with its scenic view of the infamous red cable cars and the Bay bridge... impressive.  From the moment the friendly valet guy took my keys, while walking up from the corner on to a steep hill... I knew the ambiance of this ristorante would be exactly how all previous Yelpers have described... enchantingly intimate. The warm cozy feeling that one gets when close friends and family are around is how we were greeted. We definitely had VIP treatment, and I soon found out why... I feel that i have to disclose that my review is somewhat skewed because of the fact that his cousin owns Venticello... 
I love that the main dining area is a downstairs view from the main entrance and bar. Classic elegance with candlelit tables exemplified the ideal ambiance for a date night.  He allowed the waiter to choose our bottle of wine... And it was a fabulous red blend from Sicily: Poggio Di Bortolone... I loved it!  We continued to enjoy the wine, when they served the Grilled Prawn wrapped in Pancetta (we didn't even get the chance to read the menu)... And it was delicious.  I had the Barbabietola E Fagioli: which was a Roasted Beets - Arugula salad... he ordered the Cesarean with Anchovies. They were both good salads, but I preferred mine. Our main entrees: Filet Mignon wrapped with Pancetta (his), Grilled Pork Chop (mine) both were flavorfully gratifying. And finally the freshly made tasty Tiramisu was so sinfully scrumptious, Uffa! As mentioned earlier, customer service was outstanding!
author: Myra M.

description: This is really a 3.5 but I'm happy to give them the benefit of the doubt. The food was not very memorable or particularly delicious (everything was just ok), but the ambiance was absolutely wonderful. I'm torn on going back sometime.
author: Courtney J.

description: Took my daughter here for her 21st birthday.  I had indicated that it was her birthday when I made the reservation on Open Table, and they even brought her a special dessert.  The food was great and the atmosphere was wonderful.  It was the perfect place to make a lifelong memory.
author: Susan B.

description: The gnocchi is to die for , but my waitress wasn't very attentive never refilled my drink and forgot to bring sweetener for my ice tea after I asked twice ive never seen her there before so it might have been her first day or maybe she was training but her service was sub-par and so was her tip
author: Kharey R.

description:
This was about our 5th visit for dinner last night. We love Venticellos. The service is great and comfortable. Our waiter, (never gave his name) was very personable and very knowledgable about wine when we asked him a question and later impressed us with his coffee information. We even asked questions about the food preparations and names of items we were eating and he gladly shared the info, making our evening perfect.
One of us had the Boar's Stew! It was delish and I am not a wild game kind of a gal....I had the Red Snapper and cleaned my plate. Hubs had the Risotto and scallops and his plate was clean too. Another guest had the lamb shank and unfortunately it was served cold! We did not return it, or say anything....but, it was huge do she took it home.
For dessert we had the donuts and were not impressed. They were hard and tasteless.
We made the reservation earlier that day and were happy to get a table. By the time we left, the place didn't have an empty table!
Not a monthly 'go to' spot for us....we save this spot for special occasions! Never disappointed.
author: Barbara N.

description:
The food was very good. And the ambiance was even better. The restaurant is located in a charming neighborhood in Nob Hill. When I first arrived, I noticed the picturesque view of the Bay Bridge from the sidewalk outside of the restaurant. Once inside, the restaurant is small and warm. The tables on the lower level have a view of the open, stone fireplace, which is a nice touch. 

I started my dinner with a glass of Chardonnay. The wine was very good, and the pours were huge (I had two glasses of wine that probably amounted to half a bottle). I also tried the Scampi E Pancetta Fra Diavolo and Carpaccio Cipriano. The Scampi dish was comprised of large, meaty prawns that were perfectly grilled and accompanied by a spicy sauce - very good. The Carpaccio was covered in a white truffle vinaigrette, which was amazing (in my opinion, anything with truffle oil is great). 

For my main course I ordered the lamb. Although I requested that it be cooked medium, it was a little closer to medium-well. Nevertheless, the lamb was well seasoned and very tender. The fresh vegetables served with the lamb were perfectly cooked and incredibly flavorful, and the mashed potatoes were smooth, creamy, and delicious. 

Finally, for dessert I had the Panna Cotta. Most Panna Cotta desserts that I have tried are quite dense, but this one was very very creamy. It had orange and almond flavors and was quite good. 

This place was yet another find in San Francisco and I would recommend giving it a try.
author: David S.

description:
We went on a date here Saturday night. Disappointed that we chose Venticello (on a high yelp recommendation btw). I'd also like to add context to the review; our dinner was over $150 for 2 people (with a $47 bottle of wine) which is inline with what we typically spend for dinner but also comes with an expectation of good quality at that price point.

First off, the positives: (1) Great atmosphere- the restaurant is super charming and has a beautiful view. (2) The waitstaff and host were very nice and friendly. (3) reservation was ready on time. (4) The wines were very fairly priced. We ordered a nice bottle of Hendry and were pleasantly surprised at the $47 price point (I would usually pay in the $70 range for that wine).

So some clearly positive aspects of the restaurant. The two star rating is based on the following: (1) The food was mediocre at best. Our shrimp appetizer was not flavorful at all. Our beet salad was so-so at best. We ordered the gnocchi (which was good to be fair) but the pasta dish above it on the menu (which our waitress highly recommended) we ate one bite of and then left it there bc it was not good. Came out somewhat cold and completely lacked flavor. My king crab risotto tasted like a bowl of white rice. The flavors did not blend at all and I think the rice was undercooked (very bummed here). The food experience was very poor. (2) After sitting down at the bar before our meal, it took 12 minutes before somebody asked us for our order. 12 minutes waiting to order a drink feels like an eternity and by the time the drinks finally arrived we had to carry them to our table to sit down. (3) The gentleman tending the bar, who was very nice (again to be fair), couldn't give us a wine recommendation. He said he didn't know the wine list at all. The guy serving you at the bar should at a minimum be able to offer a recommendation.

Final note: We didn't have a terrible experience, but I'm very disappointed with some very key aspects for our meal (ie the food). Hopefully it will improve.
author: Kyle J.

description: YUM!  Delicious.  My boyfriend and I came in and tried the goat cheese ravioli and the mushroom gnocchi, and both were absolutely amazing.  After we finished our plates, we were seriously considering ordering seconds -- it was that good.  The restaurant is really small, and we were within the first wave of seating, so we didn't have to experience some of the waiting that other Yelpers describe below.  Since the restaurant is fairly small and there is a bustling clientele, there was a bit of a rush felt by our waiter to finish and get out the door.  Mild, though.  All in all, this place rocks, and is a Nob Hill gem.
author: Mel G.

description: We decided to try another Italian restaurant and after reading the great reviews on Open Table and Yelp we decided to try Venticello Ristorante. The atmosphere was casual, romantic and relaxing with great service from the waiters. We started off with a Caesar Salad that was little to be desired with hardly any flavor or dressing. Then we ordered ravioli that had wonderful flavor and texture, but the pasta sauce was watery. The dinner was wonderful and so was the Pistachio Gelato. Yum. The wine selection was great and we enjoyed a beautiful bottle of Chianti Classico Reserve...
author: Jennifer G.

description:
On my third visit I realized something here. It's all about the atmosphere. The food is just ok, kinda good. Really only deserving  3 stars for food but I bump it up to 4 because of the cozy romantic atmosphere. 

That being said come here for:
1. Birthdays
2. Anniversaries
3. When you have money to burn.
4. When you need to apologize in a big way.

When not to come here:
1. First date
2. If you have a cellphone addiction and can't have a normal interaction with your dining partner.
3. If you are looking for a trendy scene.
4. If you're on a diet.
author: Roger H.

description: Wonderful food!  Very small restaurant so reservations are recommended (they do use Open Table). Not a lot of space between tables but the food is so good you'll be discussing it with neighboring diners. Parking can be difficult (it is San Francisco after all!) but the hike for the meal will be worth it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I discovered Venticello probably 15 or so years ago on my morning walk when I was staying up on Nob Hill. I fook noe that is looked nice and had a good location. I went that night for dinner and have been back many times and never been disappointed.

It is a great place for a romantic meal, although like many San Francisco places, there is limited room so some nights it can feel crowded.

The food and service can't be faulted though. The staff is professional and knowledgeable.

I love their Caesar with its white anchovies and I tend to get in ruts at a lot of restaurants, here the rosemary lamb is my usual choice, but when I stay off that it is for the rosemary, seared tuna. The DW loves the risotto with prawns and scallops and we often split the herb and goat cheese ravioli for our pasta dish.

I'd make reservation if you plan to go on the weekend.
author: Scott M.

description:
All of us enjoyed a delicious meal here while in town for the marathon. It's located in a very charming neighborhood and boasts a pretty amazing view of the Bay Bridge. We were able to sit downstairs and enjoy the view. Service was wonderful and helpful. Great wine list. 

Ravioli was wonderful, but wished there were larger portions. The Spaghetti Carbonara with pancetta is amazing. I am still thinking about it! Gnocchi with mushroom cream sauce is delicious.

Great spot for a special occasion!
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Very good food and very good service. Nice atmosphere but a bit loud at times. With wine a dinner for two was $150 with tip.
author: Jeff M.

description:
As a tourist from the east coast experiencing the west coast for the first time, I have high expectations having regularly dined in New York City. The food here was impeccable. I started my meal off with the complimentary bread and olive oil. The complaint: there was too much balsamic in the oil, which made it slightly unappealing. My salad was the caprese salad, which was amazing. I found myself using bread to collect the remaining pesto and olive oil. My entree was a sautéed pork tenderloin with spinach and potatoes. It was lightly breaded with a slightly sweet sauce. Amazing! Finally I had the mint tea along with complimentary tiramisu. Why was it complimentary?
The atmosphere was completely ridiculous. My family of four was seated by the huffy owner near the bar in front of an open door on a cold and windy night. The owner appeared to be looking down on us because we were a family in his restaurant with mostly couples and parties of friends. The door we were seated in front of was rarely ever closed unless I myself interrupted my meal to get up and shut it. The party seated behind us was friends with the owner and subsequently did as they pleased. Which meant they brought their non-service dog into the restaurant. Personally I love dogs...just not when I'm eating and also have intense allergies and asthma. The party behind us carried on loudly and bumped our table and pretended as though we were not there until we said something to the owner. The owner then moved us slightly further away from the bar and when the bill came one of our meals was taken off and the tiramisu was complimentary. The owner was very accommodating but I did not like that he allowed his friends to come in and allow him to get a bad review from someone like me. I'm still appalled a non-service dog was allowed in the restaurant. Overall: great food, extraordinarily questionable atmosphere.
author: Elena M.

description:
My girlfriend and I walked two blocks from her apartment in Nob Hill to eat at Venticello's, which we had passed on one too many times.  We made a reservation and got in right away.  While the tables were somewhat close together and limited, we didn't care because the food was so phenomenal.  

We ordered the mushroom gnocchi and the basil ravioli and split it 50/50.  After destroying both in about 5 minutes, we seriously contemplated getting an extra order of the gnocchi.  It was the best either of us had ever had, including in our multiple trips to Italy.

A little pricey, a tad bit stuffy, but well worth it for a romantic but relatively casual and delicious dining experience.  Will definitely go back!
author: Joseph Z.

description:
For atmosphere, this place is awesome. I highly recommend it as a place to getaway from it all. The menu's prices are pretty. My friend and I spent about 50 bucks for two entrees and some alki. Reservations are a must but don't really matter. I'd recommend 2nd floor for my dimly lit private seating but first floor is more well lit if you'd like to see what you're paying 25 bucks to eat. 

Rissoto was top notch but super rich. They'll custom order anything you want which should be standard in most restaurants. Other than that the menu's not super fantastic. 

Again atmosphere makes it 4 star.
author: Jon H.

description: Very lovely restaurant.  Many reviewers call this a "neighborhood" restaurant which almost makes me think of red and white tablecloths and dripping wax candles.  This is so much more fabulous.  Notable dishes were the pancetta wrapped grilled fig - excellent!  Also the special fettuccini with prawns and slightly spicy tomato sauce - yummy. Flourless chocolate cake was great.  Excellent service.
author: Patricia H.

description:
I really loved this place. The atmosphere was intimate and romantic -- a really lovely restaurant for a nice date. It was our 10th wedding anniversary, which I mentioned to the waitress. They gave us a free tiramisu to split after our meal. Unexpected, but very appreciated! 

For appetizer, we split a polenta with portabella mushroom. I'm not really a mushroom fan, but my husband is. The polenta, however, is probably the best I ever had. So creamy, so flavorful. I loved it! 

I had the pork tenderloin for dinner. It was very tender and juicy, seared perfectly on the outside. I admit that I salted it a bit -- the sauce was a rum sauce, so was sweet, and I wanted a shade more contrast. The mashed potatoes were very good, as were the veggies. My husband had the risotto, and it was perfect. 

I highly recommend this place for a special occasion. Reasonably priced for the area as well. We both had a glass of wine (generous pour!), the appetizer, and dinner for around 85 dollars. In San Francisco, that seems quite fair, especially for the quality of the food. Service was also quite good! And we much appreciated having valet parking!
author: Marcia E.

description: Wonderful experience with great friends and excellent food! Service was perfect. Pasta Carbonara is a favorite and this one is superb.
author: CS W.

description:
What a super romantic, lovely date spot! I've driven past this place a few times and it always looks crowded.  When the BF suggested a fancy date night, I inquired about Venticello.
We arrived a little before 9 for a 9:15 reservation and the place was packed. The bar area has 5 or 6 barstools that were completely taken by people eating full meals, so there really wasn't anywhere to stand and have a nice glass of wine before dinner, as the entryway isn't laid out very well.  You end up standing in a hallway where busboys are trying to get around you.

We left and headed down Taylor 1 block to get a drink, but the only other restaurant we saw also didn't have a bar...odd! So back to Venticello we went, and waited for our table.

Once we were seated, the service was pretty good. Not great. But pretty good. We received our appetizers before our bread....I found that very odd. We were so hungry and were ready for that bread!!

A nice bottle of Montepulciano later, we were loving our meals. The BF had the special of Halibut, and I had the goat cheese ravioli.

We shared a dessert and by the time we were done, we were literally the only ones left in the restaurant. Whoops!
