Our waiter could have cared less about us, in fact he forgot about us!  We ordered our wine and an appetizer to start.  About 35 minutes after he lays our appetizer down he comes over as if he was "not wanting to disturb us" to take our dinner order (it is now close to 9:30pm).  Our dinners arrive and they are pretty tasty, but nothing spectacular.  We dine, drink and enjoy ourselves.  Yet again, our waiter forgets about us and we sit with our plates in front of us... waiting.  We finally flag our waiter down to take away our plates and we have to ASK for our check....  Blah, blah, blah, I don't feel like complaining any more.
What it comes down to is - I remember Venticello being a great date spot and what it has become is a place where families and business people dine for convenience.  It is too bad, the space has serious potential.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
My boyfriend and I had our 2 yr anniversary here. First, tables are 2 inches apart, NO privacy, we were practically in our neighboring party's laps. Our waiter offered us a free sample of a wine stating the bottle had already been open anyway. When he arrived w/ the bottle and I had a question about the wines flavor, he actually poured himself a sample to "understand" what I was saying and gave himself a taste test??  Then when we decided we liked it and would order the bottle, he didnt bring a fresh bottle but he simply left that same one which we were sampling on our table. The beet salad was dry, lacking dressing and flavor, and had a total of 3.5 shavings of a beet (we counted).
The risotto tiger prawns were a flavorless pile of watery mush that tasted like it came out of Rice a Roni box. The chicken marsala was really a chunk of chicken breast smothered in thickened, sour, teryaki flavored sauce that could barely pass for edible, let alone as a marsala. 
The one positive factor was they didnt charge us for these 2 entrees.
The waiter was  a decent guy and we felt horrible sending the food back but at the same time we dropped well over $100 for the 2 of us (the bottle of wine was $30 of that).
The 2 things to recommend which we did enjoy, were the portabello risotto, and the gnocchi dish.
Lastly, the Zabionne which generally comes as a thick custard over a variety of fruit, arrived as a runny soury liquid over only strawberries and was hardly room temperature.
OVERALL, NOT WORTH THE PRICE...Also service was to par when we arrived at 6:30 pm, but by 7:30 and on, after the dinner rush, the attention we received from our waiter was seldom if any.
author: Mark K.

description: I dined here with a group of friends and we loved the atmosphere and the food - I had the mushroom gorgonzola gnocchi and the proscuitto-wrapped pear - both were OUTSTANDING!  However, we had the ABSOLUTE WORST service ever!  Our red-headed waiter was obviously irritated when we weren't ready to order yet - he sneered "Take ALL the time you need" and then NEVER returned.  We were not brought any bread either.  When we finally flagged someone down to take our order, he was professional and pleasant, but inept.  He never offered us more wine, checked on our meal, or offered dessert or coffee - just think of the $ (and tips) they missed out on!  When the busboy started clearing our plates before we were done eating (!) we asked if he could please wait, and he too was obviously angered.  Once again, no one EVER came to clear our plates.  Too bad that this restaurant staff feels the need to "punish" their diners for absolutely normal requests!  Especially in THIS economy.  More training is sorely needed for this wait-staff!  We will never return, unfortunately.
author: teresa g.

description: The minute I walked in, I was transported back to Italy!  My boyfriend took me here for Valentines Day and it was just wonderful.  He'd run by it many times, and I'd forgotten about it.  The food was yummy, the ambiance warm and cozy, the wine divine, and the service nice but not overbearing.  I can't wait to return again.  It felt like we were back in Tuscany.
author: Sharon A.

description: this is my new favorite san francisco hidden gem! venticello is a fantastic choice for a date if you're dining with someone extra-extra special..... first of all, its located in the middle of a quiet neighborhood in nob hill so its a little hard to find. once you walk in you just know its a great place.... think of Tuscany (what they modeled it after). rustic, quaint and candle-lit creating a cozy warm surrouding. we started out with some Veuve champagne and the Scampi e Pancetta Fra Diavolo. for dinner we shared a bottle of Brunello di Montalcino. my date had the lamb and i had the gnocchi.... yummm! both the food AND my date : ) to top off the experience, the service was flawless. one of those places where your server almost predicts your next desire.... we walked out at the end of the night arm-in-arm giggling. yeah, it was probably just the wine.... but i can't wait to come back again. this is one of those restaurants that you should go to for an anniversary, intimate birthday or special occasion. or any night of the week. its just that good.
author: Michelle I.

description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and I couldn't have been more impressed. Perched atop Nob Hill, it had a breathtaking view of the city. As soon as we walked in the host made us feel welcome and comfortable. The atmosphere inside was gorgeous and I felt as if I stepped into a Tuscan villa. The bread promptly brought to our table was extremely fresh and still warm as if straight out of the oven. I ordered the carbonara, with home-made pasta and wanted to faint it was so good! The cream sauce was rich in flavor, but not too heavy or salty. I could tell the pasta was home-made because it was so fresh and it was cooked perfectly al dente. I took a bite of my boyfriend's veal which was also delicious and tender. I finished with a strawberry cheesecake. I thought Cheesecake Factory was good but this put it to shame!!! It was beautifully decorated and presented. I took a bite of my boyfriend's pannacotta which was wonderful and beautiful as well. This one experience brought Venticello to the top of my list of Italian restaurants. My roommate who is a fierce food critic and self-proclaimed "foody" dipped into my left-overs and reported that even though she hates carbonara, that it was one of the best pasta dishes she had ever tasted. And that was the next day after it had been sitting in our fridge! That meant a lot to me.
author: N. M.

description: much ado about nothing. loud, food not great-sea bass yuck, too much sauce on overcooked pasta, what happened in the past year? used to be better.... don't bother. my favorite hostesses disappeared as did several other OG's last month?? i would come just to visit them, but many new people. maybe this place is under new management? either way its not good.
author: S. P.
